job.title: Legal Analyst Attorney (34082)
job.description:

job.title: Cyber Posture Management Analyst (34098)
job.description:
Title: Cyber Posture Management Analyst

Type: Direct Hire

Location: Lansing, Michigan

Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) has a large, direct client seeking a skilled Cyber Posture Mgmt. Analyst I to join the team as part of their Information Security & Privacy team. This position provides security analysis for the company's Identity and Access Management (IAM) Operation's program. This role requires knowledge across multiple platforms, applications, processes, and procedures to enable access management of business initiatives across the enterprise.

Essential Responsibilities

  • Familiar with identity and access management, with a focus on Privileged Access Management (PAM), Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), and Identity Governance and Administration (IGA).
  • Knowledge of scripting languages (e.g., PowerShell, Python) for automation and customization of IAM solutions.
  • Understanding of identity protocols and technologies: OpenID Connect (OIDC,) OAuth, SAML, AD-Fed, API Gateways, SCIM, and platforms such as, Sailpoint, CyberArk, and MS Entra.
  • Knowledge of identity & access management vulnerabilities, threats and mitigations.
  • Ability to determine how a security system works (including its resilience and dependability capabilities) and how changes in conditions, operations, or the environment will affect these outcomes.
  • Familiar with modern software life cycle development and automated cloud infrastructure deployment.
  • Understanding of network architecture, operating systems, and security protocols.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Supports initiatives and projects that will improve the organization’s cyber posture.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Understanding of security controls, risk management, and regulatory compliance (NIST CSF/SOX/GDPR/etc.).
  • Extended hours, including on-call may be required.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Ability to receive and incorporate feedback.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Strong interpersonal, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
  • Flexibility in day-to-day work.
  • Ability to learn the company’s supported systems and their interfaces with other systems.
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft software applications.
  • Ability to communicate technical concepts in an understandable fashion.
  • Ability to prioritize multiple tasks and execute efficiently and effectively while demonstrating a clear sense of urgency when appropriate.
  • Excellent customer service focus and skills.
  • Ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment to achieve desired results.
  • Scripting knowledge preferred.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience and/or education required.
  • 1+ years knowledge of financial products, regulatory requirements, and business process preferred.
  • Cloud Identity experience preferred.
  • SC-300 Microsoft Certified Identity and Access Administrator Associate preferred.
  • CISSP Certified Information Systems Security Professional preferred.

job.title: Windchill Solutions Consultant (34225)
job.description:
Engineering Systems Consulting Application Engineer – Windchill
Contract to Hire
Hybrid – Grand Rapids, MI

Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) is seeking a consulting application engineer to support the delivery of the global team and initiatives for a large direct client in Grand Rapids.  As a member of the team, using Agile practices, you will lead to timely delivery of high-quality technical solutions that drive cross-functional business strategies and initiatives.
 
THE TEAM YOU WILL BE PART OF:
 
Our Engineering Systems team is a diverse and global team, supporting the people and systems in Product Lifecycle Management (PLM). Our mission is to empower our global PLM users to bring high quality products to market faster, using best-in-class technology, consistent processes and services, and trusted data that improves the product design, launch, manufacturing, and overall lifecycle management. To accomplish our mission we are continually improving and enhancing our PLM system which provides the foundation for the Digital Thread of connected product development data.  We are passionate about the product and services we deliver to our customers and value teamwork, customer service, and good communication to achieve team objectives and company strategic goals.
 
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:
 
Key Responsibilities:
  • Actively seeks to identify breakthrough/game changing ideas for the business through the creative application of existing and emerging technologies.
  • Envisions, implements and supports solutions (technical or non-technical) to resolve business problems or improve business processes
  • Building relationships with and consulting with one or more client groups, either internal or external
  • Developing system requirements and identifying alternatives with associated costs for solutions that use Product Life Cycle Management technologies  
  • Implementing, deploying, maintaining, and upgrading solutions that use Product Life Cycle Management technologies. 
  • Lead legacy data migrations from non-Windchill systems into Windchill which includes mapping and logic definition, test method strategy, and run sheet definition.
 
Key Skills/Abilities:
  • Knowledge and understanding of Product Life Cycle Management business processes
  • Deep Windchill background that includes Workflow Design, Type and Attribute Management, Container Strategy and Access Control Policies, Object Initialization Rules, Life Cycle Definition, Team Templates, Change Process and Templates, Vaulting and Replication, Queue Management, 3D Publishing, Creo Parametric, Creo/Toolkit API, CAD Data Management, XBOM Management, Process Planning, Visual Work instructions, Parts Classification, Participant Administration with LDAP, Installation, Preferences and Properties, etc.
  • A bias for action and the ability to deal with ambiguity
  • Open minded, positive, can-do attitude
  • Ability to build trust with peers and help others when needed
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Stays current with and provides leadership/direction to the corporation in the use of new or emerging technologies, technology enhancements and upgrades.
  • Ability to uncover the standard offerings of the technology and knowledge of the future direction of the technology/company
  • Architectural thinking - holistic thinking with a focus on integration and value add
  • Accomplished Project Management and organizational skills
  • Expert in communication of all forms (written, verbal, 1:1, large groups) to any audience (internal, external, peers, executives, etc.).
 
Technical Components of the position includes such tools and technologies as: 

PTC Products:                   Windchill, Creo, ESI/TIBCO, ThingWorx
ERP Systems:                    SAP ECC, SAP S/4
Programming Skills:       Java, JavaScript, SQL
Other:                                 MS Office Suite, MS Azure DevOps
 
Who You Are:

??We are looking for someone who is self-directed and has high initiative to join our Engineering Systems team.  You should be a strong relationship builder builder with excellent communication skills, who enjoys working on projects that are large, complex, and provide new and improved capabilities to our customers.  You should be flexible, driven, energetic, and have strong technical, critical thinking, and people skills to join our team.  ?Above all, you are service-focused, serving our team, customers, and IT as well teaching and leading others with empathy.?

Minimum Qualifications:
 
  • Bachelor’s Degree in a related field required. 
  • Five years of experience working with Windchill and PLM business processes.
  • Experience working in an Agile (SCRUM) environment preferred.
 
Preferred Qualifications:
 
  • Engineering, math, accounting concepts preferred.
  • Deep experience with PTC’s Windchill and Creo Integrated Change Management (ICM), Bill of Material (BOM) Transformation, Parts Classification, and Sustainability functionality.
  • Experience with integration between Windchill and ERP systems.
  • Experience working in an Agile (SCRUM) environment preferred.

job.title: Sr Java/AWS Developer (34280)
job.description:

job.title: UI/UX Designer (34417)
job.description:
Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of a UI/UX Designer role for a 3 months contract.  This is an on-site role, so candidates local to Grand Rapids, MI area are preferred.   Qualified Candidates please provide resume. 

Job title:     UI/UX Designer

Team: Digital Product and Experience Design Location: Ada, MI

What do we need:
We are looking for a Junior Product Designer with UI and UX Design Experience to join a team of Digital Product Designers and provide UI and UX Design deliverables to Agile Product Teams.

What's special about this role:
In this role you will sit on the Amway Global Digital Product and Experience Design team (DXD) with a number of other amazing designers. You will support Agile Product Teams in delivering world class software experiences, ranging from Native iOS apps to responsive web experiences. The DXD team is made up of both high-level agency resources and internal UI/UX professionals located in Michigan, California, Singapore and around the globe.
Together, you will create next-level experiences for our customers and Amway Business Owners (ABOs). Come join a team building the future of digital products and experiences at Amway.
 

Required qualifications

  • 1-3 years experience in UX/UI Design
  • Experience providing UX Deliverables to Agile Product Teams with support from other Designers or Design Leads, including: Wireframes, User Flows, Journey Maps.
  • Ability to create Low Fidelity Mockups, High Fidelity Visual Designs, and Interactive Prototypes
  • Proficient in at least one Product Design Tool: Adobe XD, Sketch, Figma, etc (Figma is our tool of choice.)
  • Comfortable working with a design team to review designs and co-create.
  • Passion for learning and growing their design skillset.

Skills to be successful in the role:
  • Appetite for learning and growing your design skills
  • Ability to take design feedback in stride and apply it to works in progress
  • Understand user driven design for the user's experience in digital experiences
  • You enjoy collaborative problem solving with a technology team.
  • You can bring the voice of the customer/business owner to the table to inform product decisions
  • Ability to empathize with customers and needs of personas within these broader groups
  • Can draw connections between customer needs and design solutions
  • Ability to collaborate and be flexible with your product team regarding design solutions, design requirements, and time frames
  • You have a natural curiosity about human behavior and a data driven decision making mindset
  • Comfortable creating prototypes for testing and illustration purposes
  • Equally comfortable developing and communicating a point of view on experience and visual design
  • Familiar with universal design patterns for responsive web and mobile applications.
  • Experience handing off designs to development and ensuring the UI quality of the final product
  • Functional understanding of coding and ability to converse with engineering teams
  • Ability to interpret and drive business needs and user data into actionable experience changes
  • Ability create wireframes, design layouts, design components
  • Continued education and research into UX trends and current design strategy and technologies
  • Analyzing experience performance and determining design optimizations

job.title: Technical Support and Customer Service Associate (34264)
job.description:
Myticas Consulting is seeking a Bilingual (Spanish/English) Technical Support and Customer Service Associate to join our client’s Personal Support Center (PSC) team. This role is ideal for someone passionate about helping others, skilled in troubleshooting, and comfortable in a fast-paced, tech-forward environment.

What You’ll Do:

  • Provide Tier 1 technical support for software, hardware, and connectivity issues

  • Assist with password resets, software installations, VPN setups, and general troubleshooting

  • Escalate complex issues to senior team members when necessary

  • Maintain clear, professional communication in both Spanish and English across all customer interactions

  • Manage support requests via phone, email, and chat simultaneously

  • Accurately log cases in tools like ServiceNow and Zendesk

What We’re Looking For:

  • Fluency in Spanish and English (written and spoken)

  • Strong customer service and communication skills

  • Ability to quickly adapt to new tools, systems, and processes

  • Team-oriented with a willingness to learn and grow

  • Flexibility to work 1st or 2nd shift schedules

Why Join Us:

  • Hands-on training and mentoring

  • Access to a robust internal knowledge base

  • Opportunities to collaborate with tech experts and leadership

  • A supportive team environment that encourages growth

If you’re ready for a dynamic support role where no two days are the same, apply now or reach out to learn more.

job.title: Salesforce Media Cloud Solution Architect (34390)
job.description:
Salesforce Media Cloud Solutions Architect – Contract Opportunity
Remote U.S. | 12-Month Engagement | Start: January 2026
Myticas Consulting is seeking an experienced Salesforce Media Cloud Solutions Architect for a long-term consulting engagement. This is a hands-on leadership role for someone who thrives at the intersection of technology and business strategy, helping enterprise clients maximize their investment in Salesforce Media Cloud.
What You’ll Do

  • Translate business requirements into scalable Salesforce Media Cloud solutions (Ad Sales Management, Campaigns, Contracts, Placements).
  • Define and oversee solution architecture while ensuring alignment with Salesforce best practices.
  • Lead workshops, discovery sessions, and solution demos to validate and refine designs.
  • Drive cross-cloud strategy, integrating Media Cloud with Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, and Marketing Cloud.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders, product owners, and technical teams to ensure adoption and measurable business value.
  • Partner with Technical Architects to ensure technical feasibility and smooth delivery.
  • Support client adoption with documentation, training, and knowledge transfer.
What We’re Looking For
  • 7+ years of Salesforce ecosystem experience, including at least 2+ years with Media Cloud.
  • Proven success designing solutions across Ad Sales, Campaign Hierarchies, Media Plans, and Contract Lifecycle Management.
  • Expertise in Media Cloud data model, workflows, and core business processes.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Track record of leading solution design from requirements through delivery.
Preferred Experience
  • Leading Media Cloud discovery and solution workshops.
  • Familiarity with advanced Media Cloud features (inventory, forecasting, analytics).
  • Exposure to ad-tech/mar-tech integrations (FreeWheel, Google Ad Manager, Operative).
  • Agile/Scrum delivery experience.
  • Salesforce certifications such as Application Architect, Data Architect, or Industry Cloud Consultant.


This is a unique opportunity to shape enterprise-scale Media Cloud solutions while working with a dynamic team of Salesforce experts. If you’re a Salesforce Solutions Architect looking for your next consulting project, we want to hear from you!

job.title: Salesforce Media Cloud Technical Architect (34391)
job.description:
Salesforce Media Cloud Technical Architect – Contract Opportunity
Remote U.S. | 12-Month Engagement | Start: January 2026
Myticas Consulting is seeking a skilled Salesforce Media Cloud Technical Architect for a long-term consulting engagement. This is a hands-on technical leadership role where you’ll design, implement, and optimize Media Cloud solutions, ensuring scalability, integration, and performance across enterprise environments.
What You’ll Do

  • Lead the design and implementation of Salesforce Media Cloud solutions (Ad Sales Management, Campaigns, Contracts, Placements).
  • Define data models, system architecture, and integrations with ad servers, billing, and rights management platforms.
  • Drive cross-cloud integrations between Media Cloud, Service Cloud, and Marketing Cloud.
  • Establish technical best practices and mentor development teams.
  • Ensure compliance, scalability, and performance throughout the project lifecycle.
What We’re Looking For
  • 7+ years of Salesforce ecosystem experience, including 2+ years specifically with Media Cloud.
  • Proven, hands-on Media Cloud implementation expertise across Ad Sales, Campaign Hierarchies, Media Plans, and Contract Lifecycle Management.
  • Strong technical background in Apex, Lightning, SOQL, and Salesforce integrations (REST/SOAP).
  • Experience with Revenue Scheduling, Rate Cards, and Dynamic Pricing.
  • Deep knowledge of Salesforce data architecture, security, and performance optimization.
Preferred Experience
  • Familiarity with Salesforce DevOps tools (Gearset, Copado, Jenkins).
  • Agile/Scrum delivery experience.
  • Exposure to advanced Media Cloud features (inventory, forecasting, analytics).
  • Integrations with ad-tech/mar-tech platforms (FreeWheel, Google Ad Manager, Operative).


This is a high-impact consulting role where you’ll bring deep technical expertise to shape and deliver complex Salesforce Media Cloud solutions. If you’re a Technical Architect ready for your next big challenge, we’d love to connect.

job.title: Internal Audit Manager (P&C Insurance) — Part-Time, Remote (34438)
job.description:
Our Toronto client is looking for a part-time Internal Audit Manager to support regulatory and controls work for a Canadian P&C insurer. Engagement focuses on detailed control reviews, limited testing of complex controls, project management, and status reporting using a risk-based internal audit approach.

Must-Have Qualifications

  • Insurance sector experience with strong knowledge of OSFI regulations (P&C focused).

  • Hands-on internal audit experience (planning, execution, reporting) and control evaluation.

  • Familiarity with P&C products/processes and regulatory compliance requirements.

  • BAAT return experience (Business Activity Assessment Tool) — required.

  • Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.

Nice to Have

  • Professional designation (CIA, CPA, or equivalent).

  • Experience with audit methodologies/frameworks and risk management best practices.

Work Model

  • Remote delivery; up to two (2) on-site half-day visits at client’s downtown Toronto office.

job.title: SAP QM Lead (Manager Level) (34436)
job.description:
Our GTA client is looking for a senior SAP QM Lead for a contract opportunity which requires travel. The team will be delivering a large SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud program and needs a Manager-level SAP Quality Management (QM) Lead. You’ll own a focused QM scope (typically within Manufacturing/Production Execution) and provide functional leadership across design, build, and delivery in a client-facing role.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead SAP QM workstream across design, configuration, testing, and deployment in S/4HANA Private Cloud.

  • Define QM processes (inspection planning, results recording, usage decisions, quality notifications, vendor/customer QM integration) aligned to manufacturing/production execution.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (PP/PP-PI, MM, EWM, SD) to ensure end-to-end process integration.

  • Produce client-facing deliverables: solution designs, fit/gap, test strategy/scripts, cutover inputs, and hypercare support.

  • Provide day-to-day leadership, status, RAID management, and steer stakeholder alignment.

Must-Have Qualifications

  • Hands-on SAP QM expertise leading delivery on S/4HANA (Private Cloud preferred).

  • Strong integration experience with Manufacturing/Production Execution processes and adjacent modules (PP/PP-PI, MM, SD/EWM).

  • Proven client-facing leadership at manager level: workshops, design authority, and delivery governance.

Nice to Have

  • Sector experience in Mining & Metals or broader Energy.

  • Experience on large, multi-vendor S/4 programs.

job.title: High-Speed Analog Engineer (34434)
job.description:
Myticas is seeking a High-Speed Analog EDA/CAD Engineer with to support SiGE and CMOS research & development and chip design.

Description:
Seeking an High-Speed Analog EDA/CAD Engineer to support and develop SiGe and CMOS design solutions for the high speed analog ASIC design team. The engineer will be hands-on with all phases of tool flow including foundry interface, PDK installation and support, tool evaluation and installation, layout, archive and tapeout. The engineer must be an expert in analog and mixed-signal circuit design flows and tools. Tasks will include significant tool and PDK customization and design team support. The self-motivated engineer must be able to anticipate problems and devise effective solutions.
Responsibilities:
• Install, customize and support external vendor PDK’s for both SiGe and CMOS processes
• Install, customize and support Custom IC and RF CAD environment for the design of high-speed (10–40 Gb/s), broad-band, mixed-signal, integrated circuits for fiber-based wireline applications.
• Lead and contribute to the development of design standards, IC development processes, CAD tools and design flows.
• Execute and support layout efforts including archive and tapeout processes
Minimum Expertise Requirements:
• Expert in high-speed analog and mixed-signal IC design concepts and must demonstrate superior critical thinking skills, problem solving capabilities and engineering judgment.
• Fluent with analog EDA front and back end tools
o Cadence Virtuoso, ADE
o Strong SKILL programming a must
o Mentor Calibre (end user support and rule deck writing)
• Detailed understanding of advanced high-speed analog & mixed-signal layout concepts
• FlexLM license management
• Strong UNIX/Linux knowledge
• Not required but preferred
o Perforce
o Ocean scripting and advanced modelling and simulation knowledge
o Linux OS support
Minimum Experience Requirements:
• 5 years of experience working as a high-speed analog & mixed signal IC CAD professional is required
• IC Technologies: High-speed IC technologies, including CMOS and bipolar.
• IC Design Software:
o Experience with configuring, documenting, and maintaining high speed analog IC design flows is a must.
o Experience with transistor-level IC design and verification software, e.g. Cadence Composer, Cadence Virtuoso, Cadence Spectre, Virtuoso AMS, Mentor Calibre, Skill language, is a must.
• General understanding of digital physical design flows, e.g. RTL coding, place and route, DRC/LVS verification.
• Work Environment: Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment. Must be strong individual contributor, and also able to work as member of a small team. Must be able to support EPDA users and solve problems efficiently, effectively and rapidly.
Education Requirements:
• BS 5+ years
• MS 4+ years
• PhD 3+ year

$70-$100/hr. on W2 (Based upon experience)

job.title: RF Optimization Engineer (34443)
job.description:
Responsibilities:
• Coordinating with the drive test teams to make sure the drive tests are performed as per the plan and on time.
• Making sure all the CIQ data and Port Matrix Data and all other information needed to prepare SCFs is available on time.
• Follow the swap schedule on daily basis.
• Coordinate with teams, Project Management and the customer.
• Present daily, weekly swap updates to the customer in Daily/Weekly meetings.
• Maintain and update trackers for the sites that are swapped and the services delivered.
• Trigger the activities (SSV, SSS) at the right time once the swap is completed to ensure smooth running of the project.
• Investigate KPIs Quality of Service-related issues at Cell/Band/Site/Cluster Level.
• Login to the sites to check Alarms and Operations relates issues and convey them to the relevant teams.
• Evaluate the SSV/SSS/SSP reports before submitting them to the customer.
• Coordinate with GDC teams to make sure that error free reports are sent to the customer for their acceptance.
• Perform LTE/5G Parameter Audit and correlate the changes with any KPIs behavioral change.



• 5G Optimization experience covering Sub6 Optimization; DSS Optimization; mmWave Optimization; VONR, NSA, SA.
• Experience with Multi-Layer Cluster Optimization including 5G/LTE/UMTS.
• Performs RF performance activities in customer projects independently, according to project plan and in project managers guidance.
• Analysis of KPIs, investigation and improvement of network quality problems.
• Implementation of new features and tuning 5G/4G (LTE) radio network parameters.
• Experience with network performance management functions including trending, analysis, monitoring, reporting, and troubleshooting.
• Prior experience with 5G/LTE parameters, KPI counters, Operational Performance Indicator (OPI) counters, and associated call scenarios. Skills to review daily KPI reports and identify sites with performance degradation issues is required.
• Deep experience in network performance components and troubleshooting. Network performance problem detection and solution methods, e.g., throughput issues, drop call rates, access/rach failures etc. Have knowledge of tools including NetAct OSS , Web Element Manager, CM Editor, etc. creating reports and deep dive counter-based analysis.
• Understanding of Radio Resource Management functionalities, e.g., handover control, admission controls, capacity management, etc.
• Knowledge of running traces for troubleshooting/analysis. Must have knowledge of the various drive testing equipment such as JDSU/RAN Advisor, Nemo, TEMS, X-CAL, Windcatcher and FalconSmart.
• Experience with NetAct in alarm management, performance Suite management, and parameter configuration.

The following are desired/preferred
• Prior experience working with T-Mobile tools, OneData, Truecall, ActixOne, Atoll, Asset, IMNOS and RFDS.
• Hands-on experience and knowledge of TDD and FDD parameters.
• Knowledge in RF Optimization Layer 3 analysis experience using tools similar to ACTIX.
• Expertise in troubleshooting to perform tasks such as resetting an eNB/gNB/RRH, changing parameters, run XLM plans, alarms, RSSI issues
• Hands-on knowledge of monitoring site alarms, doing health check status of sites, and resolve alarms.

Education:
• MS in Electrical Engineering/Computer Science or other related Engineering. Bachelors with 10 or more years of experience also acceptable
• Strong teamwork, discipline to follow process, good communication and documentation skills. • Proficient in MS Office, especially Excel (formulas, running macros), MS PowerPoint.

Pay Range $35-$45/hr W2

job.title: Materials Manager (34445)
job.description:
Materials Manager
Location: Freer, TX
Pay Range: $45.00 - $50.00 per hour
Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental, 401(k)
Will be issued a fleet vehicle
Summary

The Materials Manager is responsible for managing the receiving, inspection, storage and transfer of all company and client procured materials and equipment to subcontractors at the various project sites. The Field Materials Manager may also direct the work of the Field Materials Coordinator, provide guidance, mentorship and facilitate their development.

Responsibilities
  • Analyze and present the material status reports to validate and verify all shipments are delivered on schedule. 
  • Advise the Procurement team of any developments that may impact the project cost, schedule and client relationship.
  • Coordinate delivery schedules and timing between the job site and procurement.
  • Direct and oversee the receiving process for all incoming shipments of materials and equipment.
  • Implement, oversee and administer all project materials reporting processes and procedures including Material Receiving Reports (MRR) and Over, Short and Damaged reports (OS&D) and distribute to the designated project and/or client personnel.
  • Perform inspections of all materials delivered to the project site.
  • Develop site logistics plans.
  • Develop, maintain and oversee all project site warehouse facilities.
  • Develop, maintain and oversee all project laydown yards.
  • Oversee the storage and maintenance of all materials and equipment as required by the specific project contract.
  • Assist Quality Assurance/Quality Control manager with preventive maintenance and associated recordkeeping of all material and equipment in storage.
  • Oversee the transfer of custody of materials and equipment to the designated subcontractors at the project site.
Requirements
  • High School Diploma/GED and 11 years direct materials management experience in the engineering and construction industry.
  • Excellent computer skills and proficiency in Microsoft Office.  
  • Experience with Primavera scheduling reports and other material/submittal tracker reports.  
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills and strong organizational skills with excellent attention to detail.  
  • Must be team oriented with good management skills and the ability to be self-motivated with little or no supervision.

job.title: Everbridge System Administrator/Project Lead (34448)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client is seeking Everbridge System Administrator/Project Lead for 24+ Months Contract role at Waukegan, IL (Open for 100% Remote).

Top 3-5 skills, experience:

  1. Candidate must have experience using everbridge system platform.
  2. Technical background using everbridge.
  3. Technical proficiency in system administration and integration.
  4. Creating incident templates, task list, conducting drills, creating groups and Rules.
  5. Bachelor Degree in Information systems, CommunicationTechnical & security + 5 year experience.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Manage user access and system permissions to ensure secure and appropriate system usage.
  • Configure notification templates and incident communication workflows to optimize response strategies.
  • Integrate the Everbridge platform with other business systems and applications as required.
  • Monitor overall system performance, proactively addressing potential issues and ensuring reliability.
  • Troubleshoot technical problems, providing timely resolution and support to users.
  • Maintain up-to-date documentation and ensure compliance with organizational policies and standards.
  • Verify data integrity from system interfaces and maintain accurate data sources.
  • Serve as the primary liaison between business stakeholders and Everbridge account management/support teams.
  • Coordinate and communicate with users, regional security teams, crisis response teams, and other
  • business functions for effective operational alignment.
  • Deliver system training sessions and user onboarding to drive adoption and competency.
  • Lead change management, governance, and implementation activities for Everbridge-related projects.
  • Provide support and guidance for Everbridge product roadmap planning and execution.
Required Qualifications:
  • Experience with Everbridge or similar crisis/incident management platforms.
  • Technical proficiency in system administration and integration.
  • Strong organizational, communication, and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to work with cross-functional and global teams.
  • Understanding of compliance, documentation standards, and change management processes.

job.title: Grid Systems Project Manager (34426)
job.description:
Grid Systems Project Manager
Location: Charlotte, North Carolina (On-site/field)

Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental, and 401(k)
Pay Range: $65.00 – $90.00

Responsibilities:
  • Apply industry experience and leading practices to architect, design, develop and implement SCADA, EMS, OMS, DMS, ADMS, and DERMS solutions to support complex business requirements.
  • Utilize in-depth knowledge of SCADA, EMS, OMS, DMS, ADMS, and DERMS to support commissioning, testing and deployment.
  • Provide field support, troubleshooting, and project coordination to enhance and maintain SCADA, EMS, OMS, DMS, ADMS, and DERMS.. This includes leading efforts in commissioning new SCADA systems and performing point testing and / or field data verification for advanced distribution applications such as FLISR, VVO, and DER Dispatch.
  • Lead or assist with program estimating, planning, and budgeting efforts and be accountable for the program/project delivery execution.
  • Support Analysis, Design, Build, Test, Triaging defects, Configuration, and Deployment activities. Ability to support Enterprise Program Management activities utilizing various methodologies such as but not limited to Waterfall and Agile methods.
  • Responsible for the successful completion of the project by budget, scope, quality, and attainment of the business objectives. In addition, supervise the overall project status and progress and ensure all scheduled milestones and delivery dates are met.
  • Responsible for overall project quality of deliverables.
  • Act as an application architect and solution architect, with responsibilities on the application and technical architecture teams.
  • Assist with or lead the business process design activities to drive out the complete application requirements: functional, quality, integration, and security.
  • Work with the application designer to create a high-level design of an end-to-end integration solution that provides a common structure for mapping the data between the applications.
  • Based on the activity and data flow diagrams, create an inventory of all cross-application interactions or interfaces, referred to as business events or messages.
  • Validate that the application requirements meet overall business process needs, are within the project scope, and are internally consistent.
  • Validate that the integration solution and integration architecture designs utilize the integration architecture components appropriately.
  • Lead or assist with completing high-level project communications and status reporting to the supporting executive team.
  • Assist with providing a central point of contact for all project interdependencies, internal and external.
  • Assist with the timely development and implementation of all stages of the system.
  • Use Project execution experience and knowledge to provide input and influence project execution processes and quality assurance/quality control protocols.
  • Ensure compliance with company and site safety policies.
  • All other duties as assigned.
Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering, Business, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a closely related field from an accredited program and 8 years of relevant experience is Required. 
  • Minimum 8 years of experience providing enterprise or operations architecture strategies, enterprise or operations integration solutions, and services leveraging various applications and technical platforms.
  • Minimum 5 years of GE e-terra ADMS experience, and 3 years of GE e-terra OMS.
  • Excellent enterprise architecture and integration skills, including data architecture, cloud architecture, middleware, communications, and other architectural methods and practices.
  • Experience in large-scale enterprise transformation projects using industry enterprise architecture strategy solutions and standard industry technologies.
  • Experience with electric utility clients implementing and integrating operational systems such as OMS, DMS, ADMS, AMI, Distribution Automation, and Distributed Energy Resources (DER) is preferred.
  • Strong ability to influence or lead project execution.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.?
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Experience with leading-edge application(s), operations technology, and solutions utilizing various industry standard tools.
  • Experience with a variety of project execution methodologies including but not limited to Waterfall and Agile.
  • Experience developing executive-level technology assessments, roadmap strategies focusing on enterprise, and operation technologies for clients in the utilities industry.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

job.title: Senior Network Architect (32577)
job.description:
We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Senior Network Architect with expertise in Segment Routing to join our dynamic and innovative team. As a Senior Network Architect, you will play a pivotal role in designing, implementing, and optimizing our network infrastructure, with a specific focus on segment routing technologies. Your deep understanding of network architecture, protocols, and best practices will contribute to the scalability, reliability, and performance of our network while ensuring alignment with business objectives.


The Sr. Network Architect is a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on all aspects of the LEO Network design and works with other LEO teams within Telesat and external contractors to ensure designs, implementation decisions, validation plans and documentation reflect the business requirements and objectives of the LEO program.

Main Responsibilities

  • Segment Routing Design and Implementation:
  • Participate in the design and implementation of segment routing solutions, ensuring optimal utilization of network resources and improved traffic engineering.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into effective network solution designs.
  • Develop strategies for partner business units to implement and manage network services implementations of segment routing architectures.
  • Network Architecture and Optimization:
  • Contribute to the architectural planning and evolution of the network, incorporating segment routing as a key technology.
  • Identify opportunities for optimization and enhanced performance using segment routing techniques, such as traffic steering, BSIDs and fast reroute mechanisms.
  • Perform network assessments and recommend improvements to maintain network health and operational efficiency.
  • Represent the LEO Network Engineering team by documenting and delivering network requirements to hardware and software development teams specifically in the areas of customer facing MEF 3.0 interface and networking design support requirements on data processing equipment
  • In coordination with Network team attend, contribute and produce materials for internal and external design and system engineering reviews for LEO Network Engineering related activities
  • Protocols and Standards:
  • Maintain a deep understanding of industry standards and protocols related to segment routing, such as IS-IS, BGP, and MPLS.
  • Stay updated with emerging trends and advancements in segment routing technologies, applying them to enhance network capabilities.
  • Troubleshooting and Problem Resolution:
  • Act as a subject matter expert, assist with complex network troubleshooting and incident resolution.
  • Collaborate with the LEO team to diagnose and address network behaviors and incidents in a timely manner, minimizing service disruptions.
  • Vendor and Solution Evaluation:
  • Evaluate new networking hardware, software, and solutions that align with segment routing strategies and network growth plans.
  • Collaborate with vendors to understand product roadmaps and provide feedback for feature enhancements.
  • Documentation and Knowledge Sharing:
  • Create and maintain detailed technical documentation, including network diagrams, configuration guidelines, and troubleshooting procedures related to segment routing.
  • Prepare and deliver materials including presentations, reference documentation and test strategies for LEO network equipment and applications deployment and operation
  • Share knowledge and mentor junior team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development.
  • With LEO Network Engineers develop and oversee plans including product idea investigations, proof of concept, Service validation and product demonstrations in Telesat LEO labs

Education and Experience

  • 10+ years of experience in carrier network design, operation and deployment
  • Broad experience or exposure across all areas of network related product design, development, verification, deployment and support
  • Understanding of Metro Ethernet Forum (MEF) standards and objectives as they relate to Carrier Ethernet Services.
  • Knowledge of routing and switching protocols, including BGP, OSPF, IS-IS, and MPLS.
  • Experience with network automation and scripting using tools such as Python, Ansible, or similar.
  • Strong troubleshooting skills and the ability to diagnose and resolve complex network issues.
  • Demonstrated leadership skills and the ability to guide and mentor junior engineers.
  • In-depth understanding of security principles and practices as they relate to network architecture.
  • Proven experience in network design, architecture, and optimization.
  • Professional certifications such as Cisco CCIE, Juniper JNCIE, or equivalent, are highly desirable.
  • Comfortable leading meetings and able to communicate issues and trends to senior management and other groups at the appropriate level of detail.
  • Excellent communication (verbal, written, presentation) and interpersonal skills.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration abilities, with a proven track record of working effectively within cross-functional teams.
  • Communicates well with own team and across organizational boundaries to ensure the successful completion of shared goals.

job.title: SAP EWM Lead (Contract) – Hybrid Winnipeg (34267)
job.description:

Responsibilities

  • Integrate EWM with MM and SD; partner with process & technical teams on end-to-end flows

  • Run workshops, create business blueprints, document requirements, and present to stakeholders

  • Troubleshoot complex issues; provide cutover and hypercare leadership

Required Qualifications

  • 10+ years SAP EWM experience

  • 3+ full lifecycle EWM implementations in a consulting capacity

  • Proven, hands-on configuration across all core EWM areas listed above

  • Strong client-facing communication & presentation skills; ability to translate technical to business language

  • Solid analytical/problem-solving skills; proactive, collaborative, accountable, able to work independently

Nice to Have

  • S/4HANA EWM 2023 experience

Work Model

  • Hybrid Winnipeg: up to 4 days/week on site (approx. 75% travel required)

job.title: Field Application Engineer (34409)
job.description:
Myticas is seeking a highly skilled Field Application Engineer (FAE) to join our client. In this role, you will act as the primary technical liaison between customers and our headquarters in Korea, focusing on resolving PCB-related quality issues and addressing technical inquiries. You will be responsible for on-site customer communication, coordinating with HQ engineering and quality teams, and providing clear explanations and solutions to ensure customer satisfaction. This position requires strong technical expertise, excellent communication skills, and the ability to manage complex quality and technical challenges in a global environment.
Key Responsibilities
  • Serve as the first point of contact for PCB quality issues and technical inquiries at customer sites
  • Communicate effectively with customers to explain issue status, root cause, corrective actions, and technical solutions
  • Collaborate closely with HQ engineering and quality teams in Korea to perform Root
  • Cause Analysis (RCA) and develop corrective measures
  • Provide technical guidance and answers to customer questions related to PCB
design, manufacturing, and reliability
  • Prepare and deliver technical reports, quality summaries, and presentations for
customers
  • Support customer audits, quality reviews, and technical workshops as needed
  • Collect customer feedback and share insights with internal teams for continuous
improvement
  • Monitor industry trends and competitive solutions related to PCB quality and technology
Required Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Electronics, or related field
  • 7–10+ years of experience in PCB design, manufacturing processes, or quality engineering
  • Strong understanding of PCB design tools (Altium, Cadence, Mentor) and
manufacturing processes
  • Proven experience in quality issue resolution, RCA, and technical troubleshooting
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills for customer-facing interactions
  • Ability to work collaboratively with teams and manage multiple priorities
  • Willingness to travel within North America

Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience with signal integrity (SI), power integrity (PI), and high-speed PCB design
  • Knowledge of industry standards (IPC, ISO) and quality certifications
  • Familiarity with semiconductor packaging or advanced PCB technologies
  • Programming or scripting knowledge (Python, C/C++, Shell scripting)
  • Project management or leadership experience
  • Strong customer-oriented mindset and problem-solving skills

job.title: Data Science & Network Modeling (34373)
job.description:
The team at Myticas Consulting is seeking a Product Owner – Data Science & Network Modelling with deep expertise in network data modelling (especially IETF YANG), machine learning, and business analysis. This role is ideal for someone who can translate complex technical challenges into actionable product strategies, enabling data-driven decision-making across satellite and ground network systems.

You will design scalable data models and machine learning pipelines, apply ML techniques in cloud environments, and work closely with stakeholders to prioritize features and align product development with business needs. As the key link between technical teams and strategic objectives, you’ll define and own the roadmap for data-centric solutions that drive operational efficiency and innovation.

Main Responsibilities

  • Own the end-to-end product lifecycle for data-driven features and models—from ideation through development, deployment, and iteration.

  • Design and oversee the development of scalable data models, with a focus on network data standards such as IETF YANG.

  • Translate business needs into clear data product requirements, ensuring alignment between stakeholders, technical teams, and strategic goals.

  • Define and prioritize product roadmaps, user stories, and backlogs in collaboration with engineering, data science, and business teams.

  • Develop and support machine learning pipelines for tasks like anomaly detection, predictive maintenance, and performance optimization.

  • Apply statistical and analytical methods (e.g., regression, clustering, outlier detection) to extract insights and support business decisions.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, ML researchers, domain experts, and executives, to deliver impactful solutions.

  • Validate and measure the success of data initiatives using relevant KPIs, A/B testing, and performance tracking frameworks.

  • Ensure data governance, quality, and compliance throughout the modeling and product development process.

  • Act as a subject matter expert on data modeling and ML applications within cloud off-the-shelf solutions and complex network infrastructures.

  • Develop and maintain YANG models for telemetry and configuration data from satellite and terrestrial networks.

  • Design data models to support anomaly detection, predictive analytics, and network optimization.

  • Use data modeling tools to extract insights from high-volume telemetry data.

  • Build real-time and batch data pipelines using Apache Kafka, Spark, and Google Dataflow.

  • Deploy ML pipelines in cloud and hybrid environments.

  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather requirements, define KPIs, and align data initiatives with strategic goals.

  • Translate complex technical findings into clear business insights and visualizations.

  • Support data governance, lineage, and metadata integration across the data lifecycle.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or a related technical field.

  • 5+ years of experience in data science, data modeling, or cloud-based machine learning, with at least 2 years in a product owner or technical leadership role.

  • Strong experience in network data modeling, especially using IETF YANG or similar data modeling languages.

  • Proficient in machine learning frameworks and in building ML pipelines in production environments.

  • Hands-on experience with statistical methods such as regression, classification, clustering, and outlier detection.

  • Familiarity with cloud platforms and data engineering tools (e.g., Spark, Kafka, Airflow).

  • Demonstrated ability to translate business needs into technical requirements, and to manage a backlog and product roadmap.

  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with experience working cross-functionally between technical and non-technical teams.

  • Experience with Agile methodologies, including sprint planning, backlog grooming, and user story definition.

  • Strong understanding of data governance, privacy, and security best practices in complex or regulated environments.

  • Experience defining or contributing to organization-wide AI strategy or governance frameworks.

  • Knowledge of AI/ML infrastructure at scale, including MLOps tools and model monitoring strategies.

  • Experience managing AI use case prioritization across multiple business domains.

  • Experience with NETCONF, RESTCONF, or gNMI (Preferred).

  • Knowledge of event-driven architectures and real-time analytics.

job.title: Site Management Supervisor (34276)
job.description:
Site Management Supervisor
Location: Denver, CO / Hybrid

Rate: $57.69-$72.11/hr.
Benefits: Medical, Dental, & Vision

**** This position includes a company vehicle with paid fuel. Candidate must be located within an hour of the Winter Park, CO area.

Qualifications:

  • Candidate must have a Level “A” wastewater license for the state of Colorado.
  • High school diploma.
  • 6 years’ experience at an industrial water/wastewater treatment facility, or municipal water/wastewater facility public works operation, including experience in project management with responsibility for technical support and financial accountability or 6 years working in a related field.
  • Understanding of industrial operations including basic fluid flow, process equipment, and control instrumentation.
  • Three years of experience at a supervisory level.
  • Ability to travel 10% of the time.
  • Possess a valid driver’s license with no major infractions.
  • Proficient with computer software including Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook, Teams), PDF software, etc.
  • Ability to perform daily computer skills managing various client software programs, SCADA, and data entry.
  • Possess sufficient virtual communication skills to successfully maintain operations and regulatory compliance while located remote from client sites.
  • Candidate needs to be able to read, understand, and abide by Industrial Regulations and Standards.
  • Candidate needs to be able to read, understand, abide by, and guide their team in compliance with client safety, quality, and other requirements.
  • Candidate must live in Winter Park, CO, or a nearby community

Responsibilities:

  • Manage staff for two locations in Colorado for a private-sector industrial client.
  • Organize and direct all onsite contract operations teams (projects) within the assigned portfolio.
  • Provide clients with effective performance in compliance with local, state, and federal regulatory agency water quality permit requirements.
  • Create a safe work culture and ensure safe work practices are followed by all staff.
  • Maintain assigned sites in Operational and Regulatory compliance.
  • Provide support, mentoring, training, and leadership to assure the highest possible effort on the part of onsite managers, local staff, and operators in the region.
  • Ensure staff stays on task and completes job related duties.
  • Assure personnel compliance with corporate reporting systems and customer reporting systems.
  • Lead O&M personnel development and training program to drive professional advancement within the organization.
  • Implement O&M training programs to develop all levels of associates at regional sites, recommend new training requirements, undertake to advance professional skills, mentor new project managers and members of the contract operating teams with a written plan.
  • Assure the implementation of all required training programs and performance reviews for new and existing projects.
  • Lead O&M Safety, Maintenance, Process Control, cost/savings, process optimization, and Sustainability efforts in the assigned portfolio.
  • Participate in the selection, assignment, and orientation of all onsite supervisors and motivate extraordinary, self-starting effort by onsite supervisors.
  • Support affirmative action and diversity efforts in the assigned portfolio.
  • Assure O&M management of the proper execution of job performance interviews and in the continuing communication of management policies to all personnel.
  • Develop all of the technical skills to function as an onsite manager and are prepared to perform these functions during project start up as well as during emergency situations.
  • Verify and complete all job-related documents and reports.
  • Maintain quality of operations and deliverables at the levels expected by client, including achievement of Key Performance Indicators (KPI) where applicable.
  • Frequently travel to sites for Client meetings, Inspections, and Operational Compliance.
  • Provide support with business development of contract operations and other efforts.
  • Report on all competitive contract services sales efforts and advises marketing personnel of these efforts and prepare other reports and presentations as required.
  • Provide primary client relationship with client management and technical personnel and report regularly as to client confidence, satisfaction, and/or problems.
  • Review monthly contract service reports for each installation, advising management as to project status, regulatory agency permit compliance, and technical/plant management attitudes.
  • Support regional personnel with the handling of local problems and in the development of client relations strategies to assure successful on-going business at each site.
  • Develop budgets and assist in the preparation of operations strategies to achieve compliance with regulatory agency requirements and O&M corporate objectives.
  • Review all monthly project reports and utilize these materials to more effectively manage O&M client services and to assure O&M's compliance with all contract provisions and client understanding and satisfaction of services rendered.
  • Actively participate in regional and local professional groups, and reports on any technology or service advancements desired by local groups and/or O&M clients.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

job.title: Licensed Electrical Engineer - Battery Storage, PV/Solar Energy (34415)
job.description:
BESS Electrical Engineer

Location: San Francisco, CA
Direct Hire role 
Compensation: Depending on experience but ranging from 130,000-190,000
 

About the Company

A rapidly growing clean energy organization is building a localized battery supply chain that integrates recovery, reuse, and recycling of critical minerals. 

We are seeking a Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS) Electrical Engineer to join our team. This role is central to designing scalable, high-performance energy storage infrastructure for both utility-scale and distributed applications. The mission is to build a sustainable circular economy for lithium-ion batteries by transforming recycled materials into high-quality inputs for new batteries.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead electrical engineering efforts for utility-scale lithium-ion BESS projects, from concept (system sizing, layout) through construction.

  • Interface with utilities and ISO/RTOs to support interconnection studies, permitting, and compliance.

  • Serve as internal subject matter expert (SME) for BESS-related technical challenges.

  • Design AC/DC electrical systems including transformers, inverters, combiners, and battery modules.

  • Develop schematic diagrams, single-line diagrams, wiring schematics, grounding, and protection strategies.

  • Specify and evaluate electrical components (breakers, contactors, fuses, EPO systems, meters).

  • Coordinate with civil, structural, SCADA, fire/life safety, and DC system teams for complete IFC packages.

  • Ensure compliance with NEC 705, NEC 706, IEEE 1547, UL 9540, NFPA 855, and local codes.

  • Support grid integration and interconnection with renewable and conventional sources.

  • Conduct power system studies (short circuit, load flow, arc flash, coordination).

  • Act as the Electrical Engineer of Record on assigned projects.

  • Stay current on BESS technologies, codes, and trends.

  • Lead R&D initiatives on integrating BESS with MVDC distribution.

  • Provide construction administration support (RFIs, submittals, site inspections).

  • Track scope, schedule, and budget across stakeholders.

  • Prepare cost estimates and schedules; perform QA/QC reviews and mentor junior engineers.

  • Contribute to internal design standards, templates, and best practices.

Desired Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering from an ABET-accredited program.

  • Professional Engineer (PE) license in Nevada or eligible via reciprocity (must obtain NV and SC PE within 2 months).

  • 5+ years of experience in solar, energy storage, or microgrids; 3+ years in BESS design/deployment.

  • Expertise in interconnection and regulatory compliance for BESS systems.

  • Advanced knowledge of NEC 705/706, IEEE 1547, UL 9540, NFPA 855.

  • Proficiency in:

    • Microgrid modeling (HOMER or similar)

    • Power system modeling (ETAP, SKM, or similar)

    • AutoCAD/Revit, Navisworks, Bluebeam, Microsoft Office

  • Preferred familiarity with:

    • PSSE/PSLF, PSCAD/EMTC

    • SEL AcSELerator or equivalent

    • HVDC and converter station design

  • Strong understanding of storage use cases (peak shaving, load shifting, demand/frequency response).

  • Highly motivated, detail-oriented, and effective communicator.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

STSI Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status

job.title: Internal Audit Consultant (Banking) (34396)
job.description:

  • Prepare clear audit reports with findings, recommendations, and action plans.

job.title: Director, Government Business Development & Proposals (34332)
job.description:
Location: Remote (Canada)
Type: Full-time, Permanent

About the Role
Our client, a global leader in advanced technology solutions, is seeking a Director of Business Development (Government Contracts). This role will spearhead expansion into federal, provincial, state, and international government markets. You’ll lead the full lifecycle of government proposals, build strategic partnerships, and secure funding/contracts that support climate action and space innovation.

What You’ll Do
  • Develop and execute a government contracting strategy.
  • Identify, qualify, and pursue opportunities with agencies (CSA, ESA, NASA, DoD, ECCC, etc.).
  • Lead government proposal writing and management (RFI, RFP, RFQ, grants, tenders).
  • Build and maintain trusted relationships with public sector stakeholders.
  • Negotiate teaming agreements and subcontractor partnerships.
  • Provide pipeline analysis and capture strategy updates to leadership.


What We’re Looking For
  • 8–10+ years of business development/proposal management in aerospace, defense, cleantech, or government contracting.
  • Proven track record leading winning multi-million-dollar proposals.
  • Familiarity with procurement systems (MERX, Buyandsell.gc.ca, SAM.gov, ESA EMITS, NASA NSPIRES).
  • Strong persuasive writing, capture management, and negotiation skills.
  • Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s or APMP certification is an asset.

Why This Role?
Join a mission-driven organization that leverages cutting-edge technology to make global impact, while shaping strategy at the intersection of environment, defense, and innovation.

job.title: ServiceNow HR Developer (34408)
job.description:
Our client in the Finance area is looking for a ServiceNow HR Developer who will enhance and support the client’s ServiceNow HR module—delivering changes to portals, catalogs, forms, and workflows while partnering closely with HR and internal technology teams.

Must-Have Qualifications

  • University degree or college diploma in business administration, statistics, or related field.

  • 5+ years hands-on experience as a ServiceNow Developer (implementations/enhancements).

  • Demonstrated expertise with ServiceNow Portals, Catalog Forms, and the HR module.

Nice to Have

  • Proven ability to prioritize and meet deadlines while handling multiple tasks.

  • Experience leading discussions with a broad set of stakeholders (HR, IT, operations).

job.title: Senior ASIC Product Engineer (34268)
job.description:
Myticas is seeking a highly skilled and motivated ASIC Product Engineer to join our clients team. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing specifications and validation methods for Analog ASICs used in datacenter transceiver products. This role involves close collaboration with multiple teams on product definition, requirements, specifications, DVT, qualification, test, and production ramp-up. The ideal candidate will be proactive, able to anticipate problems, and devise effective solutions.
 

 
HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE AND WHAT YOU WILL LEARN
  • Translate system requirements for datacenter communication ICs into detailed specifications and ensure compliance through design, test, and validation processes.
  • Develop and maintain application notes to support the integration of these ICs.
  • Serve as the liaison between the ASIC design team and module-level HW integration and test teams.
  • Drive the supply of prototype ASICs for performance and reliability validation activities.
  • Perform statistical data analysis on large datasets to characterize and improve product performance.
  • Track, troubleshoot, and resolve IC issues in collaboration with the design team.
  • Evaluate capabilities, yields, and supply planning in preparation for volume ramp following product release.
KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
  • Proven experience in product engineering, working cross-functionally to bring ASICs to market through multiple development cycles.
  • Experience working with analog ASICs with proven ability to evaluate performance and lead failure analysis
  • Strong understanding of device physics and its impact on analog circuits, with techniques to improve performance.
  • Proficiency in working with large datasets, performing statistical analysis, and presenting data and ideas to diverse audiences.
  • Excellent organizational and information management skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to enhance proficiency through programming skills and process development.
Salary Range 139,000 - 260,000

job.title: SAP Transportation Management (TM) Functional Consultant (34411)
job.description:
Our client is seeking a senior SAP TM Functional Consultant to lead delivery across Freight Order Management, TM master data, S/4 delivery-based integration, and Freight Costing & Settlement. The role is client-facing with hands-on configuration and integration responsibilities.

Key Responsibilities

  • Own Freight Order Management design, configuration, and support.

  • Set up and govern TM master data (locations, resources, lanes, etc.).

  • Deliver TM Delivery-Based Integration with S/4HANA (O2C/P2P flows).

  • Configure Freight Costing & Settlement (agreements, charges, conditions).

  • Collaborate on 3rd-party TMS integrations (e.g., Uber Freight) where applicable.

  • Provide client stakeholder management and status reporting.

Must-Have Qualifications

  • 10+ years hands-on SAP TM functional experience.

  • Proven delivery in: Freight Order Management, TM master data, TM–S/4 Delivery-Based Integration, Freight Costing & Settlement.

  • SAP TM certification (required).

  • Excellent client-facing communication and documentation skills.

Nice to Have

  • Experience integrating SAP TM with Uber Freight or other 3rd-party TMS platforms.

  • Prior work in hybrid enterprise environments (S/4HANA).

Work Model

  • Fully Remote candidates will be considered (align to ET hours)

Salesforce, etc.

job.title: Tech Writer (34298)
job.description:

Responsibilities

  • Author, edit, and format key documents (e.g., SOWs, DIDs, CDRLs, TCRs, TWPs, SORs) and related templates.

  • Maintain version control and update documentation based on feedback/spec changes.

  • Prepare weekly and monthly status reports, agendas/minutes, and support change/control communications.

  • Coordinate smooth transition of documents through review/approval and repository standards (Microsoft Office/SharePoint).

Must-Have Qualifications

  • University degree/college diploma in business administration, communications, or related field.

  • 5+ years as a Technical Writer on complex programs (Gov’t/regulated preferred).

  • Demonstrated experience producing SOW, DID, CDRL and similar artifacts to DND/GoC standards.

  • Strong stakeholder facilitation; ability to prioritize and meet deadlines across multiple concurrent tasks.

You’ll build production-grade backends in Python, integrate LLM/NLP frameworks (preferably LangChain / LangGraph), and deploy to cloud environments.

  • 2+ years hands-on as a Data Scientist / AI Engineer delivering GenAI implementations.

job.title: Automation & Controls Engineer, Senior (34406)
job.description:
Senior Automation & Controls Engineer - Food & Beverage
Location: Atlanta, GA (On-site/field)

Benefits: Access to Client Benefits Package

Description:
The Senior Automation & Controls Engineer leads and executes Automation and Controls Engineering design activities for minor to major scale Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC) projects in food, consumer products, pharmaceutical, life science, aerospace and industrial facilities.

Responsibilities:
  • Responsible for compliance with company and project site safety policies.
  • Design responsibility for all Automation and Controls scope on the project.
  • Leads a team of Automation and Controls Engineers, Specialists, and Designers in the execution of design.  Interfaces with a multi-faceted project team internally consisting of project manager, electrical, controls, estimating, procurement, construction, and other engineering disciplines.
  • Responsible for leading and developing software design deliverables including PLC and HMI programming design deliverables as well as Batch, MES, servers and virtualization.  Responsible for commissioning and startup of those design deliverables.
  • Lead and prepare controls design deliverables, including instrument/device list, I/O list, controls narratives, control panel and controls hardware design, device location plan drawings and installation details.
  • Lead the specification, design, and procurement activities for control panel and equipment vendors, manage vendor progression, and lead the Factory Acceptance Tests (FATs).
  • Lead and prepare electrical design deliverables including 480VAC and below equipment and motor power design, installation plan drawings, and conductor schedules.
  • Determine process instrument measurements protocols, such as temperature, pressure, flow, level, analyzers, and control valves. Utilize knowledge of various technologies for selecting the appropriate controls application.
  • Experienced in reviewing P&IDs and working with process engineers to define and show proper controls scope of the project.
  • Develop and manage verification of design, calculations, project studies and report preparation.
  • Interfaces directly with offsite design office and coordinates and tracks execution of controls deliverables to that office.
  • Responsible for leading and performing quality reviews of project design submittals and coordinating those reviews within the department.
  • Responsible for applying knowledge of commonly used automation and controls engineering/design concepts, principles, practices, codes, and procedures within the engineering services industry.
  • Interfaces directly with construction personnel in development of contracts and execution of work.
  • Develops project estimates at each project phase through various software such as Proposal works, Integrated Architecture Builder (IAB), SIL Solver, Bluebeam, Excel, and Visio.
  • Supports project manager in the development and tracking of automation and controls project budgets and expected progress.
  • Works with clients and vendors directly in developing design.
  • Build effective relationships with existing clients, customers and contractors and develop new business opportunities. Responsible for ensuring customer satisfaction goals and expectations are met. 
  • Provides leadership, technical direction and development to Automation and Controls team members.
  • Assists in the day-to-day allocation of resources to their projects.
  • Coordinate with field personnel to resolve design related installation issues, calculations, field inspections and testing of controls systems.
  • Responsible for leading the technical execution and team during onsite start-up and commissioning activities.
  • Responsible for developing and submitting discipline change notices as needed to the project management team.
  • Fully understands and can execute the EPC project approach.
  • This position will require making trips to job sites to survey, support installations, and lead startups (travel about 30%).
  • Work with our business development team to identify and develop key projects and customer pursuits.
  • Frequently attends and hosts client events.
  • Develop business strategies for future projects.  Understands business needs and profitability factors.
  • Reviews and develop engineering hour estimates and proposals for all phases of the project.
  • Supports interviewing and hiring process for new team members.
  • Coordinates workload with Automation and Controls Department Manager.
  • Complies with all company policies and standards.
  • All other duties as assigned.?

Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Controls, Electrical, Mechanical or Chemical Engineering or related degree from an ABET accredited program and successful completion of Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) exam and 7 years electrical engineering experience. EPC project and Automation 7 Controls experience preferred.
  • Master’s degree in electrical engineering and 6 years electrical engineering experience. EPC project experience preferred.
  • Expert knowledge in standard engineering techniques and procedures. Strong knowledge of electrical equipment design ANSI and IEEE Standards. Strong computer skills (e.g. Microsoft Office Suite).
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Experience with leading the discipline design for large projects and delegating work tasks to team members. Ability to lead execution of work and resolve issues in a team environment.
  • Demonstrated critical thinking skills, ability to work methodically and analytically in a quantitative problem-solving environment.
  • Strong attention to detail, facilitation, team building, collaboration, organization and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to perform quality reviews for detailed engineering documents and specifications.
  • Ability to travel. accredited program.
  • Must have or be able to obtain a Transportation Worker Identification Card (TWIC)
  • Professional Engineer (PE) License Preferred
  • Ability to perform quality reviews for detailed engineering documents and specifications.
  • Knowledge of applicable design standards covering Automation & Controls Design/Engineering such as NFPA, ISA, IEC, IEEE, ISA/IEC 61511, ISO13849, UL508A.
  • Experienced with variety of control and safety systems (PLC, SCADA, SIS, BMS, DCS)
  • Experience in Rockwell and Siemens PLC platform.  Experience in GE, Modicon, Opto22, Mitsubishi, and Triconex PLC platforms a plus.
  • SCADA experience with Factory Talk and Wonderware local and distributed systems, Ignition Software is a plus.
  • MES Design and Implementation Experience a Plus, PTC ThingWorx, Ignition/Sepasoft, Parsec TrakSYS.
  • Machine safety risk assessment and required PL design compliance to ISO13849 is a plus.
  • Process safety SIF/SIS design compliance to ISA/IEC 61511 is a plus.
  • Experience with PlantPAX and PackML is preferred.
  • Familiarity with tools like SISTEMA, CCW, IAB, BatchSIM, and PlantSIM is desired.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

job.title: Senior Quantitative Software Developer (34352)
job.description:
About the Role

We are seeking two highly skilled Quantitative Software Developers to join our team on a contract basis. These consultants will play a critical role in enhancing our stress testing framework, contributing to model validation, development, and optimization initiatives within a leading Canadian financial institution.
This is a hands-on technical role, ideal for senior developers with deep expertise in programming, quantitative finance, and econometrics who can contribute immediately to high-impact projects.

Key Responsibilities
  • Develop and enhance functionalities within the firm’s stress testing framework.
  • Lead and contribute to code optimization efforts to improve efficiency, scalability, and performance.
  • Support the validation and development of financial models, ensuring accuracy and compliance with internal and regulatory standards.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including model risk, validation, and development teams.
  • Provide subject matter expertise on quantitative methodologies and programming best practices.
Qualifications
  • 10+ years of relevant experience in software development and quantitative finance.
  • Must qualify for Government of Canada Security Clearance (Minimum 5 years of living in Canada)
  • Proven track record working with large financial institutions in Canada (e.g., six D-SIBs or equivalent).
  • Advanced programming skills, with deep expertise in Java and Python (additional languages a plus).
  • Strong background in quantitative finance, econometrics, and model development/validation.
  • Experience contributing to large-scale risk management or stress testing frameworks.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
Contract Details
  • Term: 6 months (possibility of extension)
  • Location: Remote, Canada-based candidates only
  • Start Date: Targeting early October 2025
If you are an experienced Quantitative Developer with a strong background in financial modeling and programming, we encourage you to apply and help drive critical risk management initiatives.
