job.title: Analytics Lead (34338)
job.description:
Description
We are a cutting-edge technology company specializing in advanced emissions monitoring and analytics. By operating proprietary satellite and aircraft sensors, and combining these with third-party data, we power an analytics pipeline that delivers actionable environmental and business insights.
This pipeline enables us to:
  • Identify and classify potential emission sources with precision.
  • Detect and quantify emissions through accurate measurements.
  • Provide intelligence to customers that drives innovation, compliance, and positive environmental outcomes.
Our structured, distributed datastore underpins this work, housing acquired data, intermediate artifacts, and pipeline outputs—an asset of significant value to analysts and aggregators worldwide.
The Opportunity
We’re seeking a visionary and hands-on Analytics Lead who will be instrumental in scaling and optimizing our analytics capabilities. Reporting to the VP of Software, you will build and lead a high-performing team of technical and subject matter experts to expand the geographical and industrial reach of our solutions.
You will act as both architect and builder of our next-generation data platform, implementing scalable analytical solutions. Beyond technical execution, you will collaborate closely with Product teams to ensure these capabilities translate into innovative features that meet evolving customer needs. This role is ideal for a technical leader who thrives on complex data challenges and understands how foundational data systems drive product innovation.

What You’ll Do
  • Technical Leadership & Development: Lead by example, providing hands-on expertise in building, optimizing, and maintaining analytics systems from ingestion to insights.
  • Data & Algorithm Innovation: Evaluate and integrate new data sources, algorithms, and emerging technologies that enhance monitoring and prediction capabilities.
  • Datastore Optimization: Design and refine datastore mechanisms, ensuring efficient data flow, integrity, and scalability.
  • Product Collaboration: Partner with Product teams to align data initiatives with business goals, enabling new customer-facing features.
  • Stay Ahead of Trends: Continuously research and integrate new technologies, ensuring our analytics remain at the forefront of the industry.
  • Team Leadership: Recruit, mentor, and grow a world-class analytics team with a culture of excellence and continuous learning.
  • Clear Communication: Articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, supporting informed strategic decisions.
Requirements
  • Engineering & Architecture Expertise: Proven experience as a developer, engineer, or architect in modern data and geospatial systems.
  • Strategic Vision: Ability to define and execute a data infrastructure roadmap aligned with organizational and product strategies.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Track record of working effectively with product, engineering, and business teams.
  • People Leadership: Strong management skills, with success in mentoring high-performing teams.
  • Executive Communication: Skilled in presenting complex information to senior leadership and boards.
  • Education: Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related quantitative field.
  • Security Clearance: Must be eligible to obtain security clearance. (5+ years living in Canada)

job.title: S4 HANA Migration Architect (34333)
job.description:
Our client is launching a 2–2.5 year SAP ECC ? S/4HANA modernization. The S/4HANA Migration Architect will provide leadership across design, migration strategy, testing readiness, and stakeholder alignment to ensure a smooth transition to a cloud-based S/4HANA environment with no disruption to business operations.

  • Guide/validate test plans & test cases leveraged during S/4HANA testing (incl. integration/UAT).

  • Facilitate communication across stakeholders and technology partners; identify & mitigate risks.

  • Support RFPs, business cases, OCM activities; prepare executive-ready documents, reports, and presentations.

  • Analyze complex problems and develop integrated, innovative solutions aligned to program goals.

Required Skills & Experience

  • Extensive hands-on experience leading large-scale ECC ? S/4HANA migrations spanning multiple domains (Finance, Procurement, Supply Chain, HCM).

  • Bachelor’s degree in business/engineering/science (or equivalent).

  • 10+ years delivering complex programs with large teams, budgets, and executive stakeholders; experience on transformations >$10M.

  • SME depth relevant to large ERP implementations; proven ability to navigate competing priorities and deadlines, maintain project artifacts, and present to executives.

  • Strong communicator with the ability to build trust across business and IT; advanced written and verbal English.

Assets (Nice to Have)

job.title: CyberArk PAM Architect / Senior PAM Engineer (34418)
job.description:
Our Financial Ottawa based client is looking for a CyberArk PAM Architect / Senior PAM Engineer to modernize and operate Privileged Access Management across on-prem and cloud, build RBAC frameworks for internally developed apps, and deliver secure credential services (CCP/Azure Key Vault) within containerized environments.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design and implement PAM architecture for internal applications in containerized (Docker/Kubernetes) environments.

  • Deliver highly available credential retrieval via CyberArk CCP and/or Azure Key Vault.

  • Define/document RBAC frameworks and integration patterns for internal apps.

  • Support modernization of CyberArk platforms (on-prem and Privilege Cloud); assess current state for simplification, scalability, and Zero Trust alignment.

  • Design/deploy CyberArk components: Vault, PVWA, CPM, PSM, PTA, CCP, web session mgmt.

  • Integrate secure auth: MFA (Microsoft), FIDO2/WebAuthn, cert-based, SAML/OIDC.

  • Implement session recording/monitoring and auditing for compliance.

  • Assist with migrations from on-prem to Privilege Cloud (incl. multi-tenant).

  • Produce repeatable integration patterns and reference architectures; own troubleshooting across PAM/IAM stacks.

  • Provide knowledge transfer, best practices, and governance recommendations.

  • Create clear, business-ready documentation for technical/non-technical audiences.

Must-Have Qualifications

  • Degree/diploma in Computer Science, Information Security, or related.

  • 10+ years in IAM with focus on PAM.

  • 5+ years hands-on with CyberArk (on-prem and/or Privilege Cloud).

  • Deep expertise with Vault, PVWA, CPM, PSM, PTA, CCP, and web sessions.

  • Proven CyberArk migration experience (on-prem ? cloud / multi-tenant).

  • Strong knowledge of SAML, OIDC, FIDO2/WebAuthn, PKI.

  • Experience designing RBAC for internally developed applications.

  • Solid technical footing in containers (Docker/K8s), networking, REST/SOAP, JSON/XML.

  • Excellent documentation, analysis, and stakeholder communication skills.

Nice to Have

  • Agile/DevOps delivery experience.

  • Security certs (e.g., CISSP, GIAC).

  • Banking and/or government sector experience.

  • Identity governance with SailPoint or Microsoft Entra ID.

job.title: FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer, Intermediate (3 Positions) (34259)
job.description:
FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer
 

We are seeking an FPGA/Hardware Engineer to help design and optimize advanced media transport and processing systems for high-performance video, audio, and data applications. This role involves hands-on design, testing, and support of production-grade solutions.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop FPGA-based solutions for video/audio transport and real-time processing (SMPTE ST 2110/IP, SDI).

  • Implement and optimize RTL designs, with a focus on 4K performance, data compression, and parallel processing.

  • Support hardware testing, debugging, and validation in lab environments.

  • Contribute to new product introduction (NPI) through design, documentation, and test activities.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams on requirements, component selection, and technical documentation.

What We’re Looking For

  • 2+ years of FPGA or hardware design experience (video/audio focus preferred).

  • Hands-on experience with Intel and/or Xilinx FPGA platforms and design tools.

  • Proficiency with SystemVerilog (preferred), VHDL, or HLS; scripting in TCL/SDC.

  • Familiarity with high-speed interfaces (Ethernet, DDR), transceivers, and timing analysis.

  • Strong problem-solving, debugging, and communication skills.

Nice to Have

  • Exposure to Linux-based development and programming in C/C++ or Python.

  • Knowledge of digital video/audio standards (SDI, AES, NMOS) and broadcast workflows.

  • Experience with packet processing, routing protocols, or PTP synchronization.

job.title: Senior, FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer (2 Positions) (34260)
job.description:
Senior FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer

We’re looking for a seasoned FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer to help architect and deliver next-generation solutions for high-performance video and data applications. This role involves taking projects from concept through to production, with a strong focus on efficiency, optimization, and real-time system performance.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead FPGA and hardware design efforts, from architecture through testing and validation.

  • Define requirements, select components, and contribute to schematic/board design decisions.

  • Develop, verify, and debug FPGA-based solutions (including UHD-SDI, high-speed transceivers, DDR interfaces, etc.).

  • Support the full product development lifecycle (design, QA, documentation, customer-facing support).

  • Collaborate across teams to ensure high-performance, production-ready solutions.

What You Bring

  • Strong background in RTL design and FPGA development (VHDL/Verilog).

  • Experience with real-time operating systems (RTOS), ideally in video, audio, or image processing.

  • Proven ability in high-volume data processing, compression, and parallel processing for 4K optimization.

  • Hands-on expertise with modern FPGA platforms (Xilinx, Intel/Altera) and related tools.

  • Familiarity with SoC integration, clock domain analysis, and timing closure.

  • Solid understanding of circuit design (power, signal integrity, microprocessor design).

  • Proficiency in debugging with lab tools (oscilloscopes, analyzers, WFMs, etc.).

  • Additional experience with C/C++/Java, scripting, and broadcast workflows is a plus.

job.title: Network Verification & Test Engineer (34227)
job.description:
We are seeking a Network Verification & Test Engineer to validate the performance, reliability, and compliance of advanced networking systems. This role involves creating verification plans, executing system-level tests, automating configurations, and working with industry-standard traffic generation tools. The ideal candidate will bring a strong networking background, hands-on testing expertise, and the ability to work both independently and in collaborative team settings.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop system and subsystem verification matrices to ensure full coverage of all system requirements.

  • Coordinate and participate in system-level testing activities, including planning, execution, and reporting of results.

  • Design, develop, and maintain test cases and test beds to support various testing scenarios.

  • Execute tests using traffic generators (e.g., Spirent, IXIA, Test Center), packet capture tools (tcpdump), and performance tools (iPerf).

  • Validate networking features and performance across OSI layers, including TCP, UDP, IP networking, routing protocols, and network optimization techniques.

  • Implement and manage NETCONF and gRPC/gNMI for automated network device configuration.

  • Work with structured data formats such as JSON, JSON IETF, XML, YAML, PROTO, and REST APIs to support automation workflows.

  • Utilize Kubernetes (POD) and Docker containers for test environment setup and management.

  • Troubleshoot and resolve performance and functional issues, ensuring timely defect identification and resolution.

Required Qualifications

  • Proven experience with traffic generation and analysis tools such as Spirent, IXIA, Test Center, tcpdump, and iPerf.

  • Strong understanding of networking fundamentals, including OSI layers, TCP/UDP/IP protocols, routing protocols, and optimization methods.

  • Experience configuring and automating network devices using NETCONF and gRPC/gNMI.

  • Proficiency with structured data formats (JSON, XML, YAML, PROTO) and REST API integration.

  • Familiarity with Kubernetes and Docker environments.

  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.

  • Ability to work independently and within cross-functional teams.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with Python or Ansible for network automation and orchestration.

  • Prior experience in network verification, system integration testing, or telecom/network equipment validation.

  • Exposure to performance benchmarking and large-scale test environments.

job.title: Senior High-Speed Analog IC Design R&D Engineer (34222)
job.description:
You will be responsible for the development of integrated circuits operating at speeds greater than 100Gbaud for next-generation products. This role involves driving multiple aspects of IC product development, including circuit design, physical layout, and silicon bring-up. You will collaborate closely with teams across verification, CAD, product engineering, and test engineering to create and execute detailed design validation test (DVT) plans and device characterization strategies.

KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Minimum Experience Requirements:

  • Proven experience in high-speed analog IC design using SiGe BiCMOS or CMOS technologies

  • Strong understanding of transmission lines and other high-frequency passive components

  • Solid grasp of device physics and its influence on analog circuit performance, along with techniques to optimize performance

  • Hands-on experience with RF wafer probing, lab instrumentation, and evaluation of high-speed analog ICs

  • Familiarity with Verilog-A and scripting languages such as Skill, Python, or shell scripts is an asset

  • Excellent teamwork, verbal, and written communication skills

Education Requirements:

  • BS with 5+ years of relevant experience

  • MS with 3+ years of relevant experience

  • PhD with related academic or professional experience


    Salary Range:  $130,000 - $260,000

job.title: Sr. Instrumentation & Controls Design Engineer (34416)
job.description:
Senior Instrumentation & Controls (I&C) Design Engineer

Location: McCarran, NV
Direct hire 
Compensation: 90,000-130,000

 

Position Overview

The Senior Instrumentation & Controls (I&C) Design Engineer will join the Infrastructure Development team to design and implement scalable, high-performance systems that support the company’s clean energy mission. This role is essential to advancing a circular economy for lithium-ion batteries by transforming recycled materials into high-quality inputs for new production.

Key Responsibilities

  • Perform instrumentation and controls design assignments with minimal supervision.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally to develop technical solutions across all project phases.

  • Utilize Revit to produce detailed construction drawings, including:

    • Instrument and control panel layouts

    • Raceway drawings (conduit/cable tray sizing, routing, and fill calculations)

    • Circuit schedules for low-voltage control signals, power, and network wiring

    • Instrument wiring details, schedules, and installation details

  • Develop and maintain instrumentation installation specifications.

  • Coordinate with electrical engineers to size or adapt cable tray systems for I&C applications.

  • Support controls engineering in the specification and selection of I&C devices to ensure process and environmental compatibility.

  • Maintain accurate documentation, including datasheets, I/O lists, valve lists, and instrument lists.

  • Assist with procurement by reviewing vendor offerings and supporting component selection.

  • Contribute to process improvements, standard templates, and design workflows.

  • Support construction observation and administration to ensure quality and compliance.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Instrumentation & Controls Engineering (or equivalent experience).

  • 4+ years of relevant I&C design experience.

  • Highly motivated, proactive, and detail-oriented.

  • Strong organizational and communication skills.

  • Advanced proficiency in Revit, Navisworks, AutoCAD, Bluebeam, and Microsoft Office.

  • Working knowledge of UL508A standards for industrial control panel design and construction.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

STSI Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

job.title: SAP S4 Business Analyst (34331)
job.description:
Our client is preparing for an SAP S/4HANA transformation and needs an experienced SAP Business Analyst to lead discovery and documentation of current-state processes across multiple functions and support migration-readiness activities.

What you’ll do

  • Run workshops to identify and document current business processes that leverage SAP ECC across Supply Chain, HCM, Finance, Procurement, and Facilities.

  • Develop strategies & templates to map processes consistently at the right level of detail for migration assessment.

  • Document current-state processes including roles/responsibilities and role headcount.

  • Analyze processes to identify gaps and optimization opportunities.

  • Partner with business & 3rd-party vendors to help document future-state processes where required.

  • Create test plans & test cases for UAT in SAP S/4HANA.

Required experience

  • Proven BA experience on SAP ECC programs, with exposure to S/4HANA initiatives.

  • Strong facilitation and documentation skills (workshops, process maps, RACI/roles).

  • Hands-on in writing UAT plans/test cases and driving user testing.

  • Excellent stakeholder communication across business and IT.

Nice to have

  • Background in ECC-S/4 migration assessments.

  • Familiarity with tools like Visio/ARIS, Azure DevOps/Jira, Solution Manager/ChaRM.

  • Public sector or healthcare experience.

Work model & compliance

job.title: Performance and Optimization Specialist (34329)
job.description:
We are looking for a Performance & Optimization Specialist for one of our clients to perform network performance, monitoring, and analysis by collecting and analyzing information, identifying the abnormalities from sources in the domain of the customer solution, diagnosing root causes of performance issues, and recommending improvement for optimization actions (i.e., QoS Optimization, parameter tuning, SW Upgrades, etc.) to meet contractual KPI targets. They find problems that were not identified during testing. In addition to diagnosing network performance issues, the Performance & Optimization Specialist generates daily/weekly/monthly reports related to technology aspects of the customer solution. The specialist performs short-term capacity utilization and traffic pattern assessments to evaluate impact on current and future architecture and recommend optimal network strategy for future traffic/capacity needs, leveraging automation techniques to reduce analysis time and other optimization related activities that involve repetition.
Required Soft skills:
a) Strong communication skills
b) Self starter who will use own deep technical expertise to assess the network configuration and come up with feature/parameter trial plan independently.
c) Ability to interact/engage customer for technical discussions, review of technical reports/analysis/recommendations
d) NAM Time zone support

Required Technical Skill Set:
1. Strong understanding of 5G NSA, SA (FDD & TDD) and LTE.
2. Past hands-on experience with trials/optimization projects for 5G NSA/SA with demonstrated experience on 5G Features for Coverage optimization (e.g. SRS Beamforming), Throughput optimization, Load balancing, layering and Traffic Steering from low to high bands..
3. Past hands-on experience with trials/optimization projects for LTE with demonstrated experience on 4G Features for Data/VoLTE Drop call improvement, Load balancing, Layering and Traffic Steering from low to high bands.
4. Ability to analyze internal syslogs, eNB/gNB EMIL/DCAP logs, TTI traces for quick troubleshooting and issue resolution for lab or field activities.
5. Expertise with UE and eNB/gNB signaling log analysis (UU, X2, S1 signaling)
6. Exposure with UE logging tools such as QXDM, XCAL, or equivalent and should be proficient with those tools.
7. Experience with Actix post processing of DT logs.

Job Responsibilities
1. Performs critical (sometimes escalated) design and performance activities in customer projects independently (complex problem solving in projects and multi-vendor environments).
2. Develops / Reviews and makes recommendations on network-wide Design covering Performance, Spectrum & Capacity supported by Recommendations (within and across the region).
3. Organizes field measurements and laboratory tests. Performs network audits, especially in cases where fault or problems exist.
4. Optimizes networks with all components based on traffic trends and customer forecasts.
5. Supports experts in developing network configuration file and interface analysis

Project Specific Roles
1. I. LTE LMS assessment and LTE Features evaluation and executing trials for Load balancing, traffic steering campaigns for movement from low to high bands.
II. LTE and VoLTE Drop call rate improvement via troubleshooting configuration issues, analysis of counters and coming up with trial plan for KPI improvement based on feature trials and parameter tuning (not look for RF shaping skillset)
III. 5G LMS assessment and 5G Features evaluation and executing trials for 5G DL/UL Throughput improvement, Coverage improvement and traffic steering from low to high bands.
IV. Troubleshooting hot topics via OSS KPIs, TTI traces, EMIL traces etc

job.title: Software Engineer (Data) (34400)
job.description:
What will you do?
  • Design, develop, and implement efficient, high-quality software solutions following SDLC best practices.
  • Write clean, testable, and well-documented code while adhering to coding standards and guidelines.
  • Lead projects from requirements scoping through launch, collaborating with team members on design, testing, and reviews.

  • Contribute to system analysis, recommend improvements, and ensure clear documentation of solutions.

Must have:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software, or Systems Engineering.
  • 6+ years’ experience as a Software Engineer in agile environments with proven delivery success.
  • Strong expertise in Java, J2EE, Spring Boot, REST APIs, Kafka, Nifi, PostgreSQL, JSON, and design patterns.
  • Strong Rate Limiter Experience
  • Decided Flink Expertise
  • Experience with Eclipse, Maven, and source control (SVN, Git).
  • Client-facing experience and excellent communication skills.
  • Strong problem-solving, analytical thinking, and ability to handle multiple projects.

Nice to have:
  • Automation testing (JUnit).
  • Experience in large enterprise IT environments.
  • Agile development with TDD/BDD.

job.title: Infrastructure Manager - Linux Subject Matter Expert (34285)
job.description:
The Manager will serve as a Linux Subject Matter Expert (SME), responsible for monitoring, maintaining, troubleshooting, and supporting high-performance computing (HPC) nodes that are critical to our client’s day-to-day operations. The role focuses on ensuring a secure, optimized, and highly available HPC environment, while delivering deep technical expertise and guidance to users and internal teams.
Candidates must be able to work onsite at least 4 days per week.
Key Responsibilities
  • Act as the primary technical expert for Linux-based HPC clusters – ensuring performance, capacity, and availability targets are met.
  • Identify, diagnose, and resolve complex second-level issues for hardware, software, network, VPN, and Linux environments; escalate as needed with full documentation.
  • Manage daily operations of Linux-based HPC environments, including patching, upgrades, security hardening, and configuration of Ubuntu and RedHat systems.
  • Support job submission and workload management using Slurm or OpenHPC, and assist end users in optimizing compute workloads.
  • Migrate existing nodes to Linux, ensuring minimal downtime and performance impact.
  • Implement and manage cluster patching/automation tools such as Foreman (or similar) to streamline operations.
  • Install and configure servers, storage, hypervisors (KVM), and other HPC infrastructure components.
  • Automate administrative tasks to improve operational efficiency.
  • Execute firewall access requests, monitor security alerts, and assist in incident response.
  • Provide second-level support and mentorship to junior technical staff, ensuring knowledge transfer and consistent process execution.
  • Develop, maintain, and publish technical documentation, KB articles, and end-user guides for new systems or upgrades.
  • Participate in on-call rotations, emergency incident response, and occasional after-hours maintenance windows.
Education & Experience
  • Diploma or Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
  • Minimum 2+ years in IT (with a related University Degree) or 7+ years in IT (with a three-year College Diploma).
  • Enterprise-level Linux expertise (Ubuntu and/or RedHat) is essential.
  • Certifications (e.g., MCSE, CISSP) are strong assets.
Specialized Skills
  • Proven track record as a Linux SME in installation, tuning, and operational support.
  • In-depth experience with HPC clusters and job scheduling tools such as Slurm, LSF, or GridEngine.
  • Strong knowledge of KVM or similar hypervisors.
  • Working understanding of network systems, protocols, and standards including Active Directory integration.
  • Identity management experience (Microsoft Identity Manager, Azure AD Connect).
  • Solid scripting skills (Bash required; additional scripting languages are an asset).
  • Experience applying advanced troubleshooting to resolve performance, configuration, or security issues.
  • Excellent problem-solving, organizational, and documentation skills.
  • Ability to communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Bilingualism (English/French) is an asset.
  • Microsoft Windows knowledge is an asset.
Decision Making & Supervision
  • Operate with minimal supervision while making decisions based on analysis, troubleshooting, and established procedures.
  • Coordinate with helpdesk, networking, platform, and security teams to ensure alignment of upgrades, patches, and operations.
Working Conditions
  • Comfortable office environment with periodic physical tasks (e.g., installing hardware).
  • Requires appropriate security clearance.
  • Must be willing to provide occasional off-hours support and participate in on-call rotation.

job.title: Data Engineer (Remote - Canada) (34327)
job.description:
Job Title: Data Engineer (Contract)
Location: Remote (Canada)

Overview:
We are seeking a skilled Data Engineer with strong experience in Databricks and AWS Cloud. This is a contract position, fully remote within Canada. The ideal candidate has hands-on experience building, optimizing, and maintaining scalable data solutions in a cloud-based environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and optimize data pipelines and workflows in Databricks.

  • Build and maintain scalable solutions on AWS Cloud.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data availability, quality, and performance.

Qualifications:

  • 4–5 years of experience as a Data Engineer (or similar role).

  • Strong expertise with Databricks and AWS Cloud services.

  • Solid understanding of ETL processes, data modeling, and performance optimization.

  • Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.

  • Assets: Relevant certifications in Databricks or AWS.

Contract: Full-time, remote (Canada).

job.title: Civil Engineer (34450)
job.description:
Civil Engineer
Location: Greenville, SC
Pay: $60.00 / hr
Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental, 401(k)
Responsibilities
  • Site development, site master planning, and site selection
  • Performing final grading plans using Civil 3D including cut and fill analysis and earthwork balancing.
  • Providing erosion and sediment control plans, stormwater pollution prevention plans, and support permit approval.
  • Hydrology analysis for designing storm drain systems.
  • Underground utility routing and site space planning using Civil 3D
  • Analyzing and designing gravity sewer systems

job.title: Data Consultant (Engineer / Architect) (34457)
job.description:
Our client is seeking an experienced Data Consultant with expertise in both Data Architecture and Data Engineering. The ideal candidate will assess the current data landscape, define the As-Is and To-Be state, and design practical solutions and roadmaps that enhance automation, integration, and reporting capabilities across the organization.
This is a hands-on, delivery-focused role—ideal for someone who can architect, engineer, and optimize modern data ecosystems end-to-end.

Key Responsibilities:
• Assess existing data platforms, pipelines, and reporting processes to define As-Is and To-Be architectures.
• Design and implement scalable data frameworks and roadmaps supporting analytics and automation.
• Build and optimize data pipelines, ETL processes, and integrations using SQL, Informatica, and related tools.
• Drive automation and process optimization to improve data reliability and performance.
• Enable and enhance self-service analytics and visualization with Power BI and/or Tableau.
• Collaborate with stakeholders to align data initiatives with business goals.
• Improve data flow (“openflows”) and ensure transparency across systems.

Required Experience:
• 7+ years of experience in Data Architecture and Data Engineering roles.
• Strong skills in SQL, Informatica, and modern ETL / data integration tools.
• Proven ability to define and implement data roadmaps and modernize legacy environments.
• Hands-on experience with Power BI and/or Tableau for dashboards and reporting.
• Demonstrated success in driving automation and data lifecycle optimization.

Nice to Have:
• Knowledge of cloud data platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
• Experience in metadata management, data governance, or data quality frameworks.
• Familiarity with CI/CD, DevOps, or DataOps practices for pipeline automation.

job.title: Accounting Manager (34399)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client, based in Riverwoods, IL or Philadelphia, PA, is currently seeking a Accounting Manager for a hybrid contract to hire position.

 

Additional Information:  W2 only!

  • Hybrid position - 2 to 3 days per week onsite, open to candidates local to Philadelphia, PA or Riverwoods, IL
  • This is a Temp-to-Hire Position 

Job Description:

The Accounting Manager plays a critical role in overseeing the accounting and financial reporting functions, ensuring accuracy, timeliness, and compliance with internal controls. This position requires a detail-oriented, analytical thinker with strong leadership capabilities and the ability to navigate complex accounting scenarios proactively.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Lead and support the month-end close and reporting process in alignment with the reporting calendar.
• Supervise and mentor accounting staff, providing guidance, performance feedback, and support to improve processes — including the quality of account reconciliations.
• Review, analyze, and approve general ledger transactions to ensure completeness and accuracy.
• Oversee the preparation and review of balance sheet account reconciliations on a monthly, quarterly, and semi-annual basis.
• Proactively identify and resolve accounting issues, escalating, when necessary, with recommended solutions.
• Support internal and external audits by providing requested documentation and addressing inquiries professionally.
• Maintain and update desktop procedures and checklists to reflect changes in processes and tools.
• Maintain and monitor month-end close, reporting, and operational checklists to ensure timely and complete task execution before sign-off.
• Prepare and review supporting schedules and financial analyses as needed.
• Collaborate effectively with internal teams and third-party service providers to ensure smooth operations.
• Conduct independent analysis to identify opportunities for process improvement and implement recommendations.
• Support the timely research and resolution of reconciling items to ensure accuracy and compliance with deadlines.
• Demonstrate adaptability to changing business requirements and provide leadership and support to staff during transitions.
• Take initiative in identifying issues and opportunities, follow through on projects, and proactively recommend solutions to improve processes and resolve challenges.

Required Qualifications/Experience/Skills: 
• 7–9 years of accounting/audit experience, including 2–3 years in a managerial role.
• Ideal candidates must have current or recent (within the past 1–2 years) experience managing teams responsible for core general ledger functions. This includes hands-on oversight of month-end close, journal entry preparation and review, balance sheet and bank reconciliations, intercompany transactions, and audit support.
• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting (BBA or BS); Master’s degree preferred.
• CPA certification or progress toward certification strongly preferred.

A strong and recent focus on GL is required to be considered for this role:
• Experience with international accounting is a plus.
• Proficiency in major ERP systems (SAP, Great Plains, NetSuite) and Blackline.
• Advanced skills in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access).
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a detail-oriented approach.
• Proven ability to manage teams and work independently in a fast-paced environment.
• Comfortable working with accelerated month-end close timelines (3–5 days).
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to foster cross-functional collaboration.
• Project management experience is highly desirable.
• Flexibility to work hybrid hours and coordinate effectively during close/reporting cycles.

job.title: Business Process Reengineering Specialist (34463)
job.description:
Job Title: Business Process Reengineering Specialist
Location: Lansing, MI 48933 (Hybrid – Onsite 2 Days/Week)
Client: Myticas' Direct Client


Please NOTE: 

  • Hybrid: Resource will be working a hybrid schedule. NO REMOTE ONLY OPTION. Will need to be onsite from day 1, two days a week (Tuesdays and Wednesdays are preferred in-office days). Candidate can be full time in office, if desired.
  • Local candidates (strongly preferred) or non-local (must be willing to relocate at their own expense from acceptance with no delays & follow the hybrid schedule)

Required Skills/Experience:
  • 5+ Years of exposure to complex IT web applications (within the past 5 years)
  • 5+ Years gathering and documenting business feedback and incorporating changes into processes
  • 5+ Years as a Business Analyst, Project Manager, or Project Coordinator supporting software development projects
  • 5+ Years working with multiple internal and external teams to support projects, business processes, and training needs
  • 5+ Years leading meetings, conducting training, and creating tailored communications and presentations
  • 3+ Years serving as a liaison between development teams and project managers or business clients
  • 1+ Year of experience with Azure DevOps, including creating User Stories and queries


Preferred Qualifications:
  • 1+ Year of experience with Federal, State, or local grant management systems (Highly Desired)
  • 1+ Year developing wireframes, mockups, and prototypes in Figma or comparable software (Highly Desired)
  • 6+ Months of project management skills and knowledge of related methodologies (Highly Desired)
  • 6+ Months of experience with Microsoft SharePoint (Highly Desired)


Job Summary:
The Michigan Department of Education (MDE) is seeking a Senior Business Process Reengineer to support the Office of Educational Supports (OES) in enhancing and maintaining the Consolidated Application within the NexSys platform. This application is critical for distributing federal formula grants to Michigan Local Education Agencies.
This role will serve as a strategic liaison between OES, regional field services consultants and managers, internal MDE cross-office teams (including the Office of Systems, Evaluation, and Technology - OSET), the Department of Technology, Management, and Budget (DTMB), and vendor partners. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in business process analysis, requirements gathering, and the software development lifecycle (SDLC), with proven leadership experience in cross-functional environments.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Process Analysis & Improvement
  • Review and document current grant-related business processes and workflows.
  • Identify opportunities for process optimization and recommend improvements.
  • Analyze federal policy changes and advise OES on necessary application updates.
  • Stakeholder Engagement & Communication
  • Facilitate meetings with business stakeholders, technical teams, and external consultants.
  • Act as the primary point of contact for field consultants regarding application issues.
  • Communicate issue status, resolutions, and updates to relevant stakeholders.
  • Operational & Technical Liaison
  • Manage and prioritize operational support requests and enhancement tickets in Azure DevOps.
  • Collaborate with OSET and vendor teams to ensure timely resolution of technical issues.
  • Translate business needs into clear, actionable technical requirements.
  • Leadership & Team Coordination
  • Lead and mentor a team of business analysts.
  • Delegate tasks effectively and ensure alignment with project goals.
  • Facilitate and lead requirement-gathering sessions with both business and technical teams.
  • Documentation & Knowledge Management
  • Maintain comprehensive documentation on the project SharePoint site.
  • Ensure all process changes and decisions are well-documented and accessible. Other Required Qualifications:
    • Proven experience in business process reengineering or business analysis.
    • Strong understanding of the software development lifecycle (SDLC).
    • Experience working with grant management systems or government-funded programs is a plus.
    • Excellent communication, facilitation, and interpersonal skills.
    • Demonstrated leadership capabilities in cross-functional team environments.
    • Proficiency with tools such as Microsoft SharePoint, Azure DevOps, and Microsoft Office Suite.
    • Self-starter with strong critical thinking and problem-solving abilities.

job.title: Structural Project Engineer (34431)
job.description:
• Title: Structural Project Engineer 
  • Location: Merrillville, IN
  • Direct hire 
  • Will travel locally 
  • Will have the ability to work hybrid 3 days on site and 2 days off after ramp up period 


  • We are seeking a Structural Project Engineer (PE) to lead single-discipline or small-to-medium multi-discipline engineering design teams through all project phases — from initial concept through successful completion. This role will manage the organization, coordination, and execution of design projects to ensure objectives are met in accordance with scope, budget, and schedule.

    Key Responsibilities

  • Plan, schedule, and coordinate technical activities and project interfaces across disciplines.

  • Develop and monitor engineering schedules, budgets, and forecasts.

  • Apply technical knowledge to identify and resolve design challenges across structural disciplines.

  • Review project deliverables for compliance with engineering principles, standards, and specifications.

  • Assign team responsibilities and establish project scope and authority levels.

  • Prepare and maintain monthly project status reports; execute engineering change authorizations as needed.

  • Collaborate with clients and internal stakeholders to define project scope, develop estimates, and ensure successful execution.

  • Provide support on asset integrity and inspection-related projects as required.

  • Education, Experience, and Skills

  • Bachelor’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering (required).

  • 5+ years of structural engineering experience in a consulting or project-based environment.

  • Knowledge of contract management and liability issues.

  • Strong ability to build trust and collaborate effectively across all levels of the organization.

  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and related engineering tools.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational abilities.

  • Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.

  • Physical Requirements

  • Ability to remain seated or standing for extended periods.

  • Frequent walking, stair climbing, bending, kneeling, and use of hands for detailed work.

  • Occasional exposure to field or site conditions, including temperature variations and elevated noise levels.

  • May require travel to project sites or client locations.

  • Must maintain a valid driver’s license and appropriate insurance coverage.

  • Why Join Us

    You’ll be part of a collaborative, mission-driven team designing high-quality, innovative, and sustainable solutions. This role offers an opportunity to lead impactful projects and grow within a dynamic engineering environment.

    Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Statement

    We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

  • Plan, schedule, and coordinate technical activities and project interfaces across disciplines.

  • Develop and monitor engineering schedules, budgets, and forecasts.

  • Apply technical knowledge to identify and resolve design challenges across structural disciplines.

  • Review project deliverables for compliance with engineering principles, standards, and specifications.

  • Assign team responsibilities and establish project scope and authority levels.

  • Prepare and maintain monthly project status reports; execute engineering change authorizations as needed.

  • Collaborate with clients and internal stakeholders to define project scope, develop estimates, and ensure successful execution.

  • Provide support on asset integrity and inspection-related projects as required.

Education, Experience, and Skills

  • Bachelor’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering (required).

  • 5+ years of structural engineering experience in a consulting or project-based environment.

  • Knowledge of contract management and liability issues.

  • Strong ability to build trust and collaborate effectively across all levels of the organization.

  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and related engineering tools.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational abilities.

  • Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to remain seated or standing for extended periods.

  • Frequent walking, stair climbing, bending, kneeling, and use of hands for detailed work.

  • Occasional exposure to field or site conditions, including temperature variations and elevated noise levels.

  • May require travel to project sites or client locations.

  • Must maintain a valid driver’s license and appropriate insurance coverage.

Why Join Us

You’ll be part of a collaborative, mission-driven team designing high-quality, innovative, and sustainable solutions. This role offers an opportunity to lead impactful projects and grow within a dynamic engineering environment.

Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Statement

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

job.title: MLOps Consultant, Senior (34474)
job.description:
Overview
Our client, a leading organization in the banking sector, is seeking a Senior MLOps Consultant with deep technical expertise in Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) and Generative AI (GenAI) to support the design, deployment, and optimization of scalable ML solutions. This is a coding-intensive, hands-on consulting role that requires strong proficiency in containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes (K8s), and experience working within secure enterprise environments.
Key Responsibilities

  • Design, implement, and optimize end-to-end MLOps pipelines for training, testing, deploying, and monitoring ML/AI models.
  • Build and maintain scalable CI/CD processes for ML workflows, ensuring automation and reproducibility.
  • Develop and deploy GenAI solutions and frameworks to support business use cases.
  • Collaborate with Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Cloud Architects to ensure reliable and secure model operations.
  • Manage containerized ML workloads using Docker and Kubernetes, ensuring optimal performance and resource utilization.
  • Integrate ML pipelines with cloud infrastructure and enterprise data systems.
  • Troubleshoot, tune, and improve model serving and monitoring processes.
  • Contribute to best practices, documentation, and governance standards across the ML lifecycle.
Required Skills & Experience
  • 7+ years of hands-on experience in software engineering, data engineering, or DevOps with a focus on MLOps.
  • Strong proficiency in Python (coding heavy role – must be comfortable writing and optimizing production-grade code).
  • Solid understanding of ML lifecycle management, model versioning, and reproducibility principles.
  • Expertise with Docker, Kubernetes, and container orchestration for ML workloads.
  • Practical experience with GenAI frameworks (e.g., LangChain, Hugging Face, OpenAI APIs, etc.).
  • Familiarity with CI/CD tools (GitLab CI, Jenkins, ArgoCD, etc.) and cloud ML platforms (AWS Sagemaker, GCP Vertex AI, or Azure ML).
  • Previous experience working in the banking or financial services sector is highly desirable.
  • Excellent problem-solving, communication, and stakeholder-management skills.

job.title: Mechanical Engineering Manager (34472)
job.description:
Mechanical Engineering Manager
Denver, Colorado
Direct Hire
Salary range: $150-185K

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Engineering Manager will lead, develop, and continuously improve the engineering and design team to complete engineering & design efforts towards project design, engineering, procurement, drafting, and product life cycle management of large scale manufactured industrial equipment. 

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Lead the engineering team on selecting and sizing equipment for fluid handling systems such as pumps, piping, valves, instrumentation, etc.   
  • Direct team to create 3D SolidWorks layouts (general arrangements), P&IDs, structural drawings, mechanical assembly drawings, and others as needed to support the production floor.  
  • Coordinate with the manufacturing shop on all fabricated, pre-assembled, and manufactured system designs.
  • Technical resource and decision-making authority to guide designs for safety, manufacturability, reliability, and within budgets. 
  • Act as an independent project manager of key accounts as required.
  • Select engineered equipment to be used in engineered product design.
  • Review/ create project proposals that accurately depict offerings to our client.
  • Proficient at guiding facility layouts due to maintenance, reliability, and serviceability needs.
  • Review mechanical and electrical manufacturing for accuracy and intended function based on the project design.
  • Liaison between the engineering/ design team and the production team
  • Coordinate material take-offs for purchase of all materials required for fabrication and installation of provided prefabricated and unitized systems.
  • Ability to review industry documents to guide designs, including ASME, ANSI, NEC, NFPA, ASTM, customer specifications, and further as required.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
  • Bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering or technical engineering, math, or science is required.
  • 5+ plus years of experience with each of the following:                  
    • Engineering design
    • Engineering management role with direct reports
    • Oil & gas surface equipment
    • Mechanical systems and associated components (i.e. pumps, piping, and instrumentation)
    • Working as an independent project manager
    •  SolidWorks
  • EIT registration is preferred.
  • Experience developing/ reviewing drawings for manufacturing of industrial equipment is required
  • SolidWorks and AutoCAD, 3D, 2D drafting experience beyond a basic level is required.
  • Experience with selection and specification of engineered equipment is required
  • Mechanical aptitude and hands-on experience is strongly preferred.
  • Microsoft Office proficiency
  • Proactive communicator that manages customer and vendor relationships.
  • Effective time management skills, personal conduct, and change management abilities.
  • Ability to lead a team of engineers and provide mentorship for individual technical and organization growth.

job.title: Electrical Engineer, Senior (34326)
job.description:

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. job.title: Data Engineer (34477)
job.description:
Our client is seeking an experienced Data Engineer to support financial operations and data-driven decision-making for a long term contract.This role focuses on developing robust data pipelines, models, and analytics to optimize cash flow processes, reconciliations, and financial reporting. You’ll collaborate across Accounting, Treasury, and Engineering to transform raw financial data into actionable insights that drive efficiency and growth.
 

Required Skills & Experience

  • 5+ years of hands-on experience in data engineering or data pipeline development.

  • Strong proficiency in SQL and Python (or similar scripting language).

  • Experience with ETL processes, data modeling, and data architecture best practices.

  • Proficiency with Apache Airflow or similar orchestration tools.

  • Solid understanding of financial principles, especially within Accounting and Treasury.

  • Proven ability to work independently, manage multiple priorities, and collaborate across teams.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field.

Nice to Have

  • Experience with Snowflake migration and Business Intelligence tools.

  • Exposure to LLM RAG applications or SAP document generation.

  • Knowledge of machine learning, data strategy, data architecture, or MDM.

  • Experience in data quality issue resolution and operational simulation.

job.title: Senior Data Engineer (2 Role) (34455)
job.description:
We are seeking a Senior Data Engineer with proven expertise in Databricks, Snowflake, and AWS Cloud. This fully remote contract role requires hands-on experience designing, developing, and optimizing scalable, secure, and high-performance data pipelines across modern cloud-based ecosystems.

Responsibilities
 
  • Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines and ETL workflows using Databricks and Snowflake.
  • Implement data ingestion, transformation, and orchestration solutions across structured and unstructured data sources.
  • Develop and optimize data models, warehouse schemas, and partitioning strategies for analytical performance.
  • Build and maintain AWS-based data infrastructure (e.g., S3, Lambda, Glue, Redshift, IAM, CloudFormation).
  • Ensure data security and compliance through encryption/decryption processes and governance frameworks (e.g., encrypt/decrypt guest reservation data).
  • Implement CI/CD pipelines for data engineering using tools like GitHub Actions, AWS CodePipeline, or Azure DevOps.
  • Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and architects to align infrastructure with business intelligence needs.
  • Monitor, troubleshoot, and resolve data pipeline performance or reliability issues.
  • Document technical solutions and follow best practices for code versioning, testing, and deployment.


Must Have
 
  • 5+ years of experience in Data Engineering, building and maintaining cloud-based data solutions.
  • Hands-on experience with Snowflake (mandatory):
    • Expertise in Snowflake SQL, data modeling, staging, warehouse optimization, time travel, and data sharing.
    • Experience integrating Snowflake with Databricks and AWS data services.
  • Strong proficiency in Databricks (PySpark, Delta Lake, notebook development).
  • Solid knowledge of AWS Cloud services such as S3, Glue, Athena, Lambda, Step Functions, and Redshift.
  • Proficiency with Python and SQL for data manipulation and ETL logic.
  • Strong understanding of ETL/ELT frameworks, data lakehouse architectures, and data governance principles.
  • Experience with data encryption, decryption, and key management best practices.
  • Excellent communication, documentation, and collaboration skills.

Nice to Have
 
  • Experience with Airflow, dbt, or AWS Glue Workflows for orchestration.
  • Familiarity with Terraform or CloudFormation for infrastructure as code.
  • Exposure to Azure Data Factory, Google BigQuery, or Kafka streaming pipelines.
  • Knowledge of CI/CD automation for data pipelines.
  • Certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Data Analytics – Specialty, Databricks Certified Data Engineer, SnowPro Core).
  • Experience working in agile environments with DevOps and Git-based workflows.

job.title: SAP HCM Functional Analyst (OM / PA) (34470)
job.description:
Overview
Our client is initiating multiple projects within the SAP Human Capital Management (HCM) domain and is seeking experienced Business Analysts with strong configuration expertise in Personnel Administration (PA) and Organizational Management (OM).
These roles will be responsible for configuring, analyzing, and supporting SAP HCM modules to enable efficient HR processes and system enhancements across the enterprise.

Key Responsibilities
  • Configure and maintain SAP HCM PA and OM modules in alignment with business requirements.
  • Analyze and document business processes to identify improvement and automation opportunities.
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders and SAP technical teams to design, implement, and validate configuration changes.
  • Ensure seamless integration with existing SAP modules and external systems.
  • Develop and maintain configuration documentation and reusable templates.
  • Participate in testing, troubleshooting, and production support activities.
  • Support release, deployment, and performance management initiatives.


Qualifications

Must Have:
 
  • Minimum 3 years of configuration experience in SAP HCM Personnel Administration (PA) and Organizational Management (OM).
  • Strong understanding of HR data models, workflows, and integration points within SAP.
  • Experience with system change/configuration management and release processes.
  • Ability to simplify and standardize complex functional requirements.

Nice to Have:
 
  • ABAP debugging or scripting skills.
  • Experience working in Agile delivery environments.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills.

Why Join
This is an excellent opportunity to contribute to a multi-project SAP HCM environment, working with a collaborative team that values expertise, initiative, and process improvement.
You’ll play a key role in enabling HR digital transformation across a large-scale enterprise landscape.

job.title: Network Sales Specialist (34475)

job.title: Change Management Lead – Application Security (34473)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client is seeking 100% Remote - Change Management Lead – Application Security for a 14 months+ contract opportunity.

Location: 100% Remote
Duration: 14 Months+ Contract

TOP 5 Skills/Experience:
  1. Proven expertise in organizational change management (OCM) using structured methodologies (e.g., Prosci).
  2. Hands-on experience driving change for technical, developer, or cybersecurity teams.
  3. Strong stakeholder engagement and communication skills across all organizational levels.
  4. Ability to design and implement training and adoption strategies for secure coding practices.
  5. Skilled in measuring adoption, managing resistance, and sustaining change initiatives.
 

Job Summary:
Serve as the lead OCM specialist for an enterprise-wide initiative in Information Security and Risk Management (ISRM) within BTS, focused on embedding secure coding practices from the outset of software and application development.
This role is integral to delivering on the 2025/2026 Cybersecurity Roadmap, enhancing organizational security posture and cyber hygiene.
The OCM lead will partner closely with developers, business stakeholders, and cross-functional teams to ensure seamless adoption and sustainment of secure software development practices.

Job Details:

  • Conduct change impact assessments to identify areas affected by the integration of secure coding standards.
  • Lead stakeholder analysis, mapping, and engagement activities to ensure all impacted groups are identified, informed, and aligned.
  • Develop and implement a multi-channel communications strategy to drive awareness, understanding, and buy-in.
  • Collaborate with the Awareness & Training team to design and deploy targeted learning strategies and materials for developers and business partners.
  • Assess organizational readiness to adopt secure coding practices and recommend interventions to address any gaps.
  • Measure and report on adoption rates, resistance points, and overall initiative progress using defined success metrics.
  • Design and execute a sustainment plan to ensure secure coding becomes a consistent part of business-as-usual (BAU) operations.
  • Serve as a key advisor and change competency advocate, keeping leadership and stakeholders informed of risks, challenges, and achievements.

Qualifications:
  • Expertise in change management methodologies, tools, and principles.
  • Change management certification required (Prosci is preferred).
  • Experience and proven success leading change initiatives, implementing technology/process changes for developer, technical or cybersecurity teams.
  • Skilled in stakeholder engagement, collaboration across all organizational levels, including IT, business, and cybersecurity functions.
  • Strong communication, facilitation, and user experience strategies, as well as developing enterprise communications, coaching, and training.
  • Ability to design and refine change strategies to drive adoption, including developing training programs and measuring OCM adoption metrics.
  • Familiarity with project management practices and tools.

job.title: Manufacturing Engineer - Contract to Hire (34476)
job.description:
Manufacturing Engineer
Contract to Hire
Grand Rapids, Michigan

Clover Consulting, a Myticas Co., is seeking a Manufacturing Engineer to be an Associate to the Senior Manufacturing Engineer.  In this position, you will lead and provide ongoing support through our manufacturing life cycle!

This is a 12 month contract opportunity, with great likelihood for Contract to Hire. This is a first shift position, hours are 7am to 4pm.

What You Will Be Doing:
With general direction, will lead the introduction of new products into the facility, improve productivity and profitability of existing production procedures, and provide ongoing support through the manufacturing life cycle. Acts as a technical expert in process technology

Improvements: Independently, with innovation and creativity, evaluates manufacturing processes to ensure optimal labor and material costs to increase productivity and profitability. Through justifications and evaluations, identifies prime areas for improvement. Tracks expenditures to ensure outlays are within budgeted amounts. Identifies, reduces, and eliminates worker exposure(s) to ergonomic stress(es) in the work place.

Floor Support: Provides timely product and process support for any manufacturing area to diagnose problems and implement solutions to minimize interruptions to production.

Special Projects: Leads the implementation of significant product, process, or other corporate change initiatives being introduced into the plant.

Strategic/Manufacturing Planning: Provides advanced research to introduce/integrate new processes, equipment, and technologies into the company

Who You Are:
Preferred Skills and Competencies
  • Very strong analysis skills: process, capacity, cost/benefit, waste stream, and quality tools.
  • Internal and external quality support/management
  • Knowledge in lean manufacturing techniques: flow, PQ, equipment reliability, and set up reduction.
  • Facilitation and negotiation skills
  • Knowledge of material handling
  • Productivity improvement techniques: RCI’s
  • Behavior sciences (logic, sociology, etc.)
  • Economics and financial analysis
  • Work measurement
  • Interpersonal skills
  • Computer skills; advanced level required to utilize Excel and Access programs
  • Experience in design, specification, purchase, and installation of new equipment
  • Experience in the Engineering Design Process
  • Knowledge of simulation, process modeling, and value stream mapping
  • Project management and leadership ability
  • Occupational Bio Mechanics/Human Factors Engineering
  • Strategic planning
Required Skills and Competencies
  • 4 year technical degree or equivalent education.
